As a robot, his consistency spans the entire day.""<br>#620<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 悼</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 悼  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=621"">lament</br></br></a>  ""When the world's most eminent magician died, everyone's state of mind became that of lamentation. He was buried with his famous sun-flower wand in his hand.""<br><br> ""Data laments that he could never see his eminent father, his creator, ever again. He paints a picture of his father, that looks like a sunflower in the shape of a magic wand.""<br>#621<br></span>"

(Image: Data meditating in a sitting lotus position).""<br>#622<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 怖</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 怖  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=623"">dreadful こわい</br></br></a>  Someone in a dreadful state of mind has crawled into his bed and is hiding under the sheets (linens).<br><br> ""Being an android, Data is white as a sheet. Doctor Crusher always has to remind herself that this is perfectly normal. From a doctor's perspective, he really does look dreadful.""<br>#623<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 慌</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 慌  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=624"">disconcerted 慌てる</br></br></a>  (re: wazzab) The state of mind of the people of New Orleans as they examined their city's concert hall laid waste can best described as disconcerted.<br><br> <br>#624<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 悔</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 悔  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=625"">repent</br></br></a>  <br><br> ""When you repent, you heal your state of mind by going over every thing you regret doing.""<br>#625<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 憎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 憎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=626"">hate にくむ</br></br></a>  ""Like the saying goes, Hate just begets Hate. A state of mind that just increases and increases until it explodes.""<br><br> Data's one true emotion is hate for Prince's music. (Image: Data hunched over hands to his ears and screaming while Picard bobs to Purple Rain).<br>#626<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 慣</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 慣  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=627"">accustomed</br></br></a>  Some hardcore monks have a state of mind that has become accustomed to their self-torture through piercing themselves.<br><br> <br>#627<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 愉</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 愉  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=628"">pleasure ゆ快</br></br></a>  ""At the meeting of butchers, in their narrow state of mind, they throw lame jokes around like, 'Oh hello, it's a pleasure to meat you', and find this rather pleasing.""<br><br> ""Image : Data attending a meeting of the butchers union. As a joke to begin his speech he says, 'Its a pleasure to MEAT you all.' (thanx to Shibo & nestOr).""<br>#628<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 惰</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 惰  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=629"">lazy</br></br></a>  <br><br> ""When in a lazy state of mind, the things you need to do are left for next month.""<br>#629<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 慎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 慎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=630"">humility</br></br></a>  Humility is the state of mind of accepting the truth about yourself - both favorable and unfavorable.<br><br> Humility is a state of mind when you consider yourself in accordance with the truth (you neither boast nor demean yourself).<br>#630<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 憾</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 憾  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=631"">remorse うらみ</br></br></a>  Remorse is the state of mind where I feel bad for what I did while I was tired and emotional!<br><br> ""Tip: If you are confusing this keyword, remorse, with repent (#625) and regret/resentment (#1460), then note that rEMOrse contains EMOtion.""<br>#631<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 憶</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 憶  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=632"">recollection</br></br></a>  Recollection is about bringing ideas back to your mind.<br><br> <br>#632<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 慕</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 慕  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=633"">pining</br></br></a>  ""Pining, yearn for... etc. Presumably for lost love. An easy one here, someone standing in the graveyard, placing an old valentine card amonst all the existing tributes.""<br><br> ""Morticia and Gomez (of the “Addams Family”) are spending their Valentine's Day at the graveyard, pining for each other's affection.""<br>#633<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 添</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 添  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=634"">annexed</br></br></a>  ""Hawaii is a little drop of heaven nestled in the waters of the Pacific, most often visited by honeymooners and valentines. It was annexed to the U.S.A. in 1959, and more recently to Japan as well-- albeit only unofficially, and through private commercial holdings.""<br><br> <br>#634<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 必</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 必  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=635"">invariably</br></br></a>  ""You swear you'll be in love forever, but invariably there comes a time when your heart is divided.""<br><br> ""For this kanji I invariably got the stroke order wrong. I nearly lost heart, but decided to stick (pun) to it. Then I noticed the order is 1) katakana ソ (altered slightly); 2) fishhook; 3) two drops. Now I invariably get it right.""<br>#635<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 泌</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 泌  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=636"">ooze</br></br></a>  Anything full of water will invariably begin to ooze.<br><br> ""When you pierce a heart with a stake, it invariably oozes blood.""<br>#636<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 手</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 手  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=637"">hand</br></br></a>  ""This pictograph actually really works if you look at it as a hand with fingers spread and middle finger pointing down. see the very top stroke as the edge of a shirt cuff, and it will all come together.""<br><br> A hand is useful for 千一(1001) things.<br>#637<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 看</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 看  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=638"">watch over</br></br></a>  ""It's a hot day of summer with a clear sky, you're sitting outside a cafe (or maybe on a reclining chair in the garden), and you watch over the kids with a <b>hand covering your eyes</b> from the sunlight (next time, don't forget the sunglasses).""<br><br> ""Think of the monster from Pan's Labrynth, that watched over the poor girl with eyes in the palm of his hands.""<br>#638<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 摩</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 摩  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=639"">chafe</br></br></a>  ""If you grind the hemp without a stone but use your hand instead it will chafe. (Image: """"Robin, why are your hands all chafed?"""" 'Uh... (I've been grinding hemp all day)').""<br><br> ""When the feds came to bust your little hemp grove, you jumped out the back side of the cave and tried to repel down with a hemp rope. Unfortunately, the rope chafed your hands and you fell .. ouch!""<br>#639<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 我</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 我  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=640"">ego</br></br></a>  ""Someone with a huge EGO is too good for any romantic partner and as such has nothing but personal """"hand fiestas"""" with himself every night.""<br><br> Did you hear about the guy who had such a big EGO that he threw a fiesta for his left hand?<br>#640<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 義</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 義  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=641"">righteousness</br></br></a>  ""Righteous Christians are sheep with egos (reworked from raulir, fixes word order to match radical order).""<br><br> ""On the other hand, Woman tend to have too much self-righteousness to allow any man to touch their wooly black sheep this results in similar hand fiestas.""<br>#641<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 議</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 議  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=642"">deliberation　会議</br></br></a>  Careful deliberation produces words of righteousness.<br><br> ""At the worst of times, a jury's deliberation descends into a war of words between competing self-righteous, power-tripping bastards.""<br>#642<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 犠</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 犠  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=643"">sacrifice</br></br></a>  A cow that is righteous sacrifices her milk for the human race.<br><br> ""Cows are truly righteous animals. They SACRIFICE their milk so that we can have some. And if they don't have any left, they give a sheep a hand fiesta (good lord this is going too far) and give us that instead. What righteous cows.""<br>#643<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 抹</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 抹  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=644"">rub まっ消 抹殺</br></br></a>  ""I like to RUB my FINGERS over my EXTREMITIES ....like my extremity-ly long, umm, hair.... This has been edited in response to being reported ...you can change """"hair"""" to whatever extremity-ly long body part you like.""<br><br> ""When you're cold, your RUB your FINGERS over your EXTREMITIES vigorously to warm up a bit. I'd still rather go in for a warm fire and some hot cocoa, though.""<br>#644<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 抱</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 抱  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=645"">embrace</br></br></a>  ""When embracing someone, wrap your fingers around her butt for added effect. You may think of """"bound with snakes"""" as a description of the fingers slithering around the buttocks, if you want a particularly graphic image.""<br><br> ""Here, I'm picturing that scene from ET (the extra terrestrial), where ET hugs Elliot before leaving. You see that EMBRACE is ET's long FINGERS that WRAP around Elliot.""<br>#645<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 搭</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 搭  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=646"">board とうさい</br></br></a>  ""Now boarding the pagoda ride. Please keep your fingers inside at all times..."""".<br><br> When you board the ship on the way out from Hawaii a beautiful crewmember takes her fingers and fits a lei around you ....a lei is flowers fitted together with your fingers.<br>#646<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 抄</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 抄  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=647"">extract すくう</br></br></a>  You can extract her juices by inserting a few fingers. ;)<br><br> <br>#647<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 抗</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 抗  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=648"">confront</br></br></a>  ""Gandalf confronts the evil beast, shouting """"you shall not pass!"""". He holds up a single finger and sends forth a whirlwind.""<br><br> Imagine a thumb war. A confrontation of fingers in a whirlwind.<br>#648<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 批</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 批  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=649"">criticism ひ判</br></br></a>  <br><br> My criticism earned me the FINGER when I COMPARED her cooking to my mother's.<br>#649<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 招</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 招  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=650"">beckon まねく</br></br></a>  ""A Geisha beckons you with her index finger, and as you approach she runs her fingers all over her body in an attempt to seduce you. Keyword meaning : “invite”.""<br><br> ""I bet you all know the Maneki Neko, or beckoning cat, who with its raised fingers tries to seduce all good things (success, happiness and harmony) to its owner.""<br>#650<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 拓</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 拓  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=651"">clear the land</br></br></a>  ""A huge index finger coming down from the sky is kicking boulders of rock, clearing the land. Maybe it's the finger of God preparing a place for his little people to live.""<br><br> ""I imagine clearing the land in order to set up your tent after a long day of backpacking. Using your fingers, you pick up all of the rocks and get them out of the way so that you can get a comfortable night sleep. If you don't clear the land you can just picture the rock sticking into your back as you toss and turn all night long.""<br>#651<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 拍</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 拍  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=652"">clap</br></br></a>  <br><br> ""I clapped so hard, my fingers became white.""<br>#652<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 打</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 打  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=653"">strike</br></br></a>  <br><br> My teacher used to strike my fingers with a street sign.<br>#653<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 拘</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 拘  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=654"">arrest</br></br></a>  ""You approach the thief from behind, stick your finger at his back to fake a gun, and say the phrase """"You're under arrest"""".""<br><br> Giving the police the finger and a colorful phrase is a surefire way to get arrested.<br>#654<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 捨</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 捨  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=655"">discard</br></br></a>  Someone stuck their fingers in my cottage cheese! I'm going to have to discard the lot!<br><br> ""The wicked witch from Hansel and Gretel only likes the meaty parts of kids. Outside her candy cottage, you can see a pile of discarded fingers.""<br>#655<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 拐</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 拐  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=656"">kidnap かい引</br></br></a>  ""Wrap your FINGERS around someone's MOUTH to keep them quiet, then put the KNIFE to their throat to ensure their cooperation. This is the best way to KIDNAP someone.""<br><br> ""After you beckon (#650) someone by seducing them, you kidnap them and hang them upside down (the reversed positions of seduce).""<br>#656<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 摘</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 摘  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=657"">pinch</br></br></a>  <br><br> &gt;_&lt; Don't you hate when your antique aunt PINCHES your cheeks with her antique fingers? <br>#657<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 挑</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 挑  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=658"">challenge</br></br></a>  ""Here comes a new challenge, try to kill Bowser, the giant Turtle using just one finger.""<br><br> ""You are sure to take a challenge because your victory was portended. So you stand self-confident before your foe, point a finger at him and say """"I will prevail, as was long portended!"""".""<br>#658<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 指</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 指  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=659"">finger ゆび</br></br></a>  Finger lickin' delicious.<br><br> ""I remember this not as finger which has too many uses elsewhere but as """"fingering"""" then its easy: fingering some delicious...""<br>#659<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 持</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 持  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=660"">hold</br></br></a>  ""At the BUDDHIST TEMPLE you'll see wonderous things, such as the priest that can HOLD himself upside down with just a FINGER.""<br><br> ""In Kyaiktiyo, there is rocking stone which sits on the edge of a cliff, and there is a Buddhist temple built on the top of it. You can rock the stone by pushing it with your finger, but it still holds in place. It's true, see here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyaiktiyo.""<br>#660<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 括</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 括  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=661"">fasten</br></br></a>  Teacher was always telling us to fasten our lips by pulling a zipper shut with our<b> fingers</b>. It always frightened me because I imagined getting my<b> tongue </b>stuck in the zipper.<br><br> ""On the plane, you refuse to FASTEN your seatbelt and even go so far as to give the stewardess the finger and stick out your tongue at her. The crew comes and pins you down and forces you to FASTEN it.""<br>#661<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 揮</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 揮  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=662"">brandish</br></br></a>  ""A <b>military</b> leader in his chariot is brandishing his <b>finger</b> at the enemy, crying """"chaaaaaaaaarrrgggeeee!"""".""<br><br> ""Think of the movie Gladiator but instead Maximus is brandishing a giant foam brand name (nike, rebok, adidas, whatever) finger like you see at a baseball game. He's riding in a chariot using the foam finger to kill his enemy.""<br>#662<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 推</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 推  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=663"">conjecture すい測</br></br></a>  ""In mathematics, a conjecture is a mathematical statement which has been proposed as a true statement, but which no one has yet been able to prove or disprove. Have you heard of the Finger-Turkey conjecture ? It states that if turkeys had fingers, they would be able to count. Be sure to imagine a turkey with fingers at the tip of its wings, counting from one to ten.""<br><br> ""In the midst of conjecture on whether it was done or not, mom stuck her fingers in the turkey to check.""<br>#663<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 揚</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 揚  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=664"">hoist </br></br></a>  My piggy bank is so heavy that I cannot HOIST it using just my fingers.<br><br> <br>#664<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 提</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 提  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=665"">propose 提案</br></br></a>  ""When a man PROPOSES to a lady, he takes her FINGER and places the ring on it JUST SO, and the moment sweeps her away.""<br><br> ""I tried to propose to my girlfriend, but the ring was too small to fit her finger. Instead of saying yes, she just uttered an annoyed sigh. So I rushed to the jeweler where he made it bigger. But now it was too big, so I rushed back to make it smaller. This spiel kept going on until the ring was finally just so. Her eyes lit up and she said yes.""<br>#665<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 損</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 損  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=666"">damage そん</br></br></a>  ""Boss yells, """"Who damaged the photocopier?!"""" fingers of employees point at one another.""<br><br> ""If you finger your employee, you risk incurring many damages from a possible sexual harassment lawsuit.""<br>#666<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 拾</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 拾  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=667"">pick up</br></br></a>  I tried to PICK UP the bowling ball...but my FINGERS didn't FIT in the holes.<br><br> Try PICKING UP a girl by trying to FIT your FINGER in you know what... let me know how that works.<br>#667<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 担</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 担  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=668"">shouldering</br></br></a>  ""One of Hercules' labors was to hold the world in his <b>fingers </b>for Atlas and not move until <b>nightbreak</b>, shouldering the considerable burden.""<br><br> One of the classic stories of shouldering a heavy burden is that of the kid who had to stick his finger on a dam until nightbreak to prevent it from breaking down.<br>#668<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 拠</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 拠  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=669"">foothold 根拠</br></br></a>  ""When rockclimbing, when your weight disposes of the valuble foothold, all that's left is your <b>fingers</b> keeping you from death. Meanwhile, your <b>walking legs</b> are left dangling in the <b>wind.</b>""<br><br> ""Once you have a good foothold, you can dispose of your fingerhold.""<br>#669<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 描</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 描  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=670"">sketch</br></br></a>  ""A sketch (drawn by hand) is a seedling (#234) of things to come.""<br><br> <br>#670<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 操</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 操  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=671"">maneuver あやつる</br></br></a>  Using just a finger you are trying to maneuver your furniture round your room.""<br><br> Luke skywalker points his fingers and uses the force to maneuver the goods through the tree branches and up over the tree.<br>#671<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 接</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 接  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=672"">touch せっしている</br></br></a>  ""A pervert meets a woman. The pervert tries to touch the women with his lustful fingers. The woman takes a vase, lifts it over her head and smashes it on the pervert's head...""<br><br> CHIKAN!! These are the perverts who use their fingers to touch standing women on crowded trains.<br>#672<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 掲</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 掲  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=673"">put up a notice</br></br></a>  ""A muchacho puts up a notice that says “NO <b>FINGER</b> SNAPPING ALLOWED. MUCHACHOS ON <b>SIESTA</b>”. The muchachos are sleeping soundly, completely oblivious to the sound of dogs barking, guitar playing and even gun shots. Now imagine one tourist passing by and snapping his fingers and waking up all the muchachos at once.""<br><br> ""Just as I was finished putting up a """"no siestas"""" notice on my property, a muchacho gave me the finger, sat down, and promptly fell asleep.""<br>#673<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 掛</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 掛  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=674"">hang かける</br></br></a>  ""Think RPG. The wizard points his<b> finger</b> to the guard and the <b>ivy</b> he has just animated with his <b>magic wand </b>climbs down the wall to hang the poor guy, opening the way for the adventurers into the dungeon.""<br><br> ""3 ways you could hang something: 1) the normal way, with your finger putting something on a hook or whatever, 2) hanging from a vine the natural way, or 3) by means of the magic of the wand.""<br>#674<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 研</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 研  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=675"">polish 研究</br></br></a>  My stones are so huge that it takes two hands to polish them!<br><br> You use two hands to polish a stone: one to hold it and the other to rub it.<br>#675<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 戒</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 戒  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=676"">commandment/two hands fiesta primitive</br></br></a>  ""<b>Two hands</b>, <b>fiesta</b>.....when moses received the ten commandments with <b>two hands</b>, he went back down the mountain and threw a<b> fiesta </b>with the jews, celebrating the arrival of the commandments.""<br><br> ""When Moses returned with the commandments in his hands he saw that his people were throwing a fiesta. At first he was excited. Then he looked around and got pissed. """"Awww, c'mon guys. Golden idols? Really?"""".""<br>#676<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 械</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 械  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=677"">contraption</br></br></a>  <br><br> Think of a complex wooden contraption capable of giving you a two-handed fiesta.<br>#677<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鼻</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鼻  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=678"">nose はな</br></br></a>  An Egyptian embalmer reaching <b>both hands</b> into the dead pharaoh's <b>nose</b> and yanking out handfuls of <b>brain</b>.<br><br> I sneezed so hard that through my NOSE I blew out my BRAINS into BOTH HANDS.<br>#678<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 刑</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 刑  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=679"">punish 刑事局</br></br></a>  This kanji is for severe punishment. A man has his shackled <b>hands (both) </b>placed on a wood block and they're chopped off with a <b>saber.</b> No more stealing bread in the Middle East...<br><br> In Arab countries they punish theives by cutting off BOTH HANDS with a SABRE.<br>#679<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 型</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 型  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=680"">mould</br></br></a>  ""A famous ninja once pressed his <b>two hands</b> and <b>saber</b> into the<b> soil</b> of his temple, before going onto a mission from which he never came back. Think of some sort of signature that he left behind him. The mould of his two hands and saber has since become a popular attraction in the area.""<br><br> As a PUNISHMENT they made me lay face down in the DIRT leaving a nice imprinted MOULD of my whole BODY.<br>#680<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 才</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 才  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=681"">genius</br></br></a>  <div>A TEN year old had a STROKE of GENIUS and wrote this joke: 何歳ですか？　　　。。。天才です！.</div><br><br> ""Spinal tap: """"Every other band's amps go to ten. But you see my extra stroke of genius - these go to eleven.""""."" <br>#681<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 財</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 財  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=682"">property ざいさん　さいふ　ざい</br></br></a>  ""If you're a money genius, you can afford a lot of property.""<br><br> ""The keyword refers to property in the sense of money or funds rather than of buildings or real estate. Keep this one distinct from frame 193 (“wealth”) and frame 473 (“assets”).<br>#682<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 材</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 材  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=683"">lumber </br></br></a>  A TREE GENIUS is a LUMBER jack. Duh.<br><br> ""Just when the were about to turn the last tree into lumber, the Lorax (the tree-genie) jumps out and puts a stop to the whole affair.""<br>#683<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 存</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 存  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=684"">suppose そん在</br></br></a>  ""How do you suppose they manage to cram a genie inside a bottle? Well, I suppose they put him in there while he's still a little child...""<br><br> ""Villagers on a little remote island one day find a bottle washed out by the sea onto the beach. After wiping the bottle and taking a closer look, they are amazed to see a (very small) child in it. The villagers suppose that the child is a genie in a bottle.""<br>#684<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 在</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 在  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=685"">exist そん在</br></br></a>  Genie in the bottle does exist but you need to dig deep into the soil to find one.<br><br> ""You wipe the soil from the bottle, only to have a genie float out above you, saying: 'I am the genie in a bottle, what is your wish?' So now you know that they do exist.""<br>#685<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 乃</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 乃  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=686"">from</br></br></a>  FROM a pictograph of a thumbs up. That's how it also gets the primitive meaning of fist.<br><br> ""Think Charlton Heston: """"From my cold, dead fists"""". Speech given to the National Boxing Association, in response to stricter control on boxing gloves.""<br>#686<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 携</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 携  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=687"">portable</br></br></a>  <br><br> ""Because they have no fingers, turkeys must use their fists when dialing on a portable phone.""<br>#687<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 及</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 及  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=688"">reach out</br></br></a>  I like to think of this as a fist with with brass knuckles because of the extra line. An old school thug reaches out to help you up but then with his other hand ( with the brass knuckles) punches you.<br><br> Reach out and fist someone (Do you see the person primitive?).<br>#688<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 吸</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 吸  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=689"">suck</br></br></a>  ""Imagine a baby reaching out and holding mom's breast as if it were bottle, and sucking on it to get some milk.""<br><br> An open mouth and reaching hands : a baby wants to suck at his mother's breast.<br>#689<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 扱</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 扱  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=690"">handle</br></br></a>  ""See suck (#689): if it's too big to handle, just use your fingers instead...""<br><br> One of the first thing a baby can do with his hand is to reach out and grab your finger as if it was a little handle.<br>#690<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 丈</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 丈  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=691"">length</br></br></a>  Both a meter and a yard are about one arm-length.<br><br> ""This kanji reminds me of the kanji for big (I think it looks the same kinda of except for the last stroke). Maybe this works for guys, but when you were growing up you would compare """"length"""" with your friends trying to show how BIG you were. You wouldn't show """"it"""" but you would spread your arms out as wide as possible to exaggerate your length. Maybe even so wide that you trip (I the 3rd stroke getting pushed over)! I just find it easier to relate this to the previous kanji.""<br>#691<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 史</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 史  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=692"">history</br></br></a>  I sleep in history class with my mouth tucked under my arm.<br><br> ""History students usually going to school with a history book tucked under their arm. But now instead of a book, you have a small talking mouth that tell you about history. """"When I was young, I used to walk 5 miles everyday....."""".""<br>#692<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 吏</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 吏  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=693"">officer</br></br></a>  One officer can change the course of history.<br><br> ""One officer, namely Napoleon, changed the course of history. (Thanks, ayoung24). Napoleon is also my primitive meaning.""<br>#693<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 更</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 更  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=694"">grow late さら</br></br></a>  ""It's starting to GROW LATE, so God will take the SUN, and TUCK IT UNDER HIS ARM, and walk away. In the morning, he'll bring it back, so don't worry.""<br><br> ""At nightbreak (#30) the sun rises above the floor, so it is logical that when it is growing late, the sun would rise to the ceiling. Time to pack up your things and take your belongings under your arm.""<br>#694<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 硬</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 硬  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=695"">stiff</br></br></a>  A stiff drink on the ROCKs after it GROWS LATE is a way to unwind after a long day...<br><br> ""Stones are so stiff that even if you spent all day straining trying to change their shape, it would grow late far before you ever accomplished your task.""<br>#695<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 又</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 又  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=696"">or again/again</br></br></a>  ""Crotch""<br><br> ""This keyword should really be """"again"""" not """"or again"""" Here is some context: think of the phrase """"Jya mata"""" """"じゃ又"""" which is a farewell similar to """"then again"""". Also """"Mata ne"""" """"又ね"""" and mata ashita (again tomorrow) """"又明日""""。 Note this kanji is rarely used, most of the time JP people spell it out """"mata"""" except for in the last example: 又明日.""<br>#696<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 双</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 双  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=697"">pair</br></br></a>  Noah had to carefully check the two crotches in each pair to ensure that the animals were of different sexes and thus able to further their species after the flood.<br><br> <br>#697<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 桑</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 桑  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=698"">mulberry</br></br></a>  ""Children going around the mulberry tree singing """"This is the way we wash our crotch, wash our crotch, wash our crotch..."""".""<br><br> ""Imagine kids all over the top of a mulberry tree, sitting astride limbs so that their weight is on their crotches. (Mulberry trees have big sprawling limbs that run horizontally or at shallow angles making them easy to climb and sit in. I have an old mulberry in my yard, and my kids are in it constantly).""<br>#698<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 隻</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 隻  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=699"">vessels </br></br></a>  ""On Vessels that travel long distances, sailors often get quite lonely. They keep TURKEYS on the VESSELS, but not for use as food. The lonely sailors take turns enjoying the turkey's CROTCH.""<br><br> ""Donald Duck is a big bird that does not wear pants. It's good to use him as a mnemonic because he is a sailor, and this kanji is used to count vessels.""<br>#699<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 護</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 護  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=700"">safeguard</br></br></a>  ""Think of the flower-vessels as a the Greenpeace vessel “Arctic Sunrise”, only instead of a rainbow there is a big flower painted on the hull (this will come back in seize (#701) and harvest (#908)). Think of “flower-power” and of the “peace” in “Greenpeace” and it will make some sense hopefully. -- In this kanji, we see an inauguration speech being given before the Greenpeace vessel is set afloat and sent to safeguard our planet.""<br><br> ""(With sarcasm) A Bush speech telling how all the US vessels are always welcomed, covered with flowers and words of gratitude for safeguarding democracy from the evil doers.""<br>#700<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 獲</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 獲  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=701"">seize</br></br></a>  ""A pack of genetically-modified wild dogs is seized by a group of Greenpeace activists and taken onboard the Greenpeace vessel (the flower vessel, see safeguard (#700)).""<br><br> Customs just seized a crate of poppies (flowers) detected by trained wild dogs who inspected the vessel.<br>#701<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 奴</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 奴  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=702"">guy やつ</br></br></a>  ""That GUY stole my WOMAN so I kicked him in the CROTCH. (This story helps keep the word """"GUY"""" as someone you hold in contempt).""<br><br> Guys only care about 2 things: women and their crotch (preferably at the same time).<br>#702<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 怒</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 怒  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=703"">angry</br></br></a>  <br><br> WOMEN get very ANGRY over the thought that GUYS are more interested in her CROTCH than her HEART.<br>#703<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 友</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 友  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=704"">friend</br></br></a>  ""A good friend is always at your side. ---- I teach at a Japanese High School, and I often see chummy male students grabbing each other's crotches in a joking manner. It's still weird to me, but apparently reaching to your side and grabbing you neighbor's crotch is a great way to express friendship.""<br><br> ""Think of a sex friend (a fuck buddy if you will). The benefit of such a relationship is that there will always be a crotch by your side. (the Japanese refer to such a friend as セフレ, just as we do).""<br>#704<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 抜</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 抜  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=705"">slip out</br></br></a>  Don't let good friends slip out between your fingers.<br><br> ""Imagine a cliché Hollywood situation: one person is lying on the edge of the abyss and another (presumably his friend) is hanging, only thing holding him is the grip of their hands. Then fingers slip out of the grip and he falls in said abyss.""<br>#705<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 投</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 投  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=706"">throw</br></br></a>  ""Well, you usually use your fingers to throw objects used as missile weapons. Easy. By the way, for those of you looking for a less anachronistic image for the missile primitive as a modern rocket, try a slingshot. it's a crotch (originally a tree branch) that sends missile projectiles flying into/like the wind. And for this present kanji, it is something you naturally use with your fingers...""<br><br> ""If you use the primitive """"semen"""" (flying in the wind from your crotch) instead of missile then all kanjis with this primitive will hilariously create a perfect story.""<br>#706<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 没</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 没  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=707"">drown</br></br></a>  (Note: this kanji is more collapse/cave-in/sink (#1888) than humans drowning) A water missile? A torpedo! And when it hits it's target? The ship collapses then sinks and everyone drowns!<br><br> ""The submarine's hull was breached after being struck by a torpedo (""""water missile""""), causing the entire crew to drown.""<br>#707<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 設</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 設  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=708"">establishment</br></br></a>  ""Establishment can be attacked by words or by missiles. Writers will use words, whereas militars will use missiles.""<br><br> ""When you attack the establishment with words, it fights back with missiles.""<br>#708<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 撃</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 撃  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=709"">beat</br></br></a>  ""Your car has missles?! That beats mine, hands down.""<br><br> Think 3 methods of attack all combined into 1 kanji: 1. Vehicle to transport troops 2. Once troops have disembarked they have their missiles 3. If they run out of missiles they resort to hand to hand combat to beat the enemy.<br>#709<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 殻</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 殻  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=710"">husk&nbsp;から</br></br></a>  Samurai's husk/shell/armour is superflous to missile attacks 甲殻　卵殻　貝殻.<br><br> husk or shell. Japan's recent history in a nutshell: first the samurai became superfluous and then the Americans started to throw missiles and bombs during WWII.<br>#710<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 支</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 支  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=711"">branch ささえる</br></br></a>  Picture sliding down the branch of a tree (in this case a pine tree or any tree with needles) and getting a bunch of needles stuck in your crotch--ouch!!<br><br> ""A special branch of the military called the Needle Crotch Unit. Their only weapon is the needle embedded in their crotches, and they're quite adept at using them.""<br>#711<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 技</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 技  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=712"">skill わざ</br></br></a>  Balancing a branch on your finger is the prototypical example of a skill that is nothing more than a skill (i.e., it is completely useless).<br><br> ""I think of a guy balancing a branch on his finger, which definitely takes some minimal amount of skill.""<br>#712<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 枝</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 枝  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=713"">bough</br></br></a>  The tree's primary branch is known as the bough.<br><br> ""Differentiate between BOUGH and branch (#711): 'branch' is smaller, and can also refer to the branch of a store (支店), which has nothing to do with a tree. But a BOUGH is a main part of a tree, perhaps where the trunk splits into several large boughs, and so it logically utilizes the 木 radical.""<br>#713<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 肢</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 肢  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=714"">limb</br></br></a>  limbs are """"flesh branches""""<br><br> <br>#714<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 茎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 茎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=715"">stalk くき</br></br></a>  ""Suggestion: Replace """"spool"""" with """"toilet paper/roll"""". Reasons: (1) Toilet paper/roll usually comes on a spool. (2) Toilet paper is used to clean the soil off your crotch. Story: Just get a flower and carefully wrap some toilet paper around its stalk. Spool also appears in suspicious (#716), lightly (#717), diameter (#882), sutra (#1360).""<br><br> ""PRIMITIVE: soiled crotch = soiled underwear. To precent anyone from picking the beautiful flower, the gardner hung soiled underwear on the stalk.""<br>#715<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 怪</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 怪  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=716"">suspicious あやしい</br></br></a>  ""When you're suspicious, your state of mind twists round and round like a spool of thread.""<br><br> Imagine a loud farting sound on The Enterprise (sorry). Everyone looks around trying to find who did it. The one looking most suspicious is Data. His soiled crotch gives him away.<br>#716<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 軽</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 軽  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=717"">lightly かるい</br></br></a>  <br><br> ""I want to tread lightly on the environment.... That's why I CAR-SPOOL to work everyday.... I know, lame.""<br>#717<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 叔</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 叔  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=718"">uncle</br></br></a>  Oh come on people - say what we've all been thinking: the uncle is that creepy guy towering above a little one's crotch.<br><br> ""Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your UNCLE was full of loneliness (#720) (寂), and he lived by himself. He was naturally graceful (#721) (淑) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team). You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he watched over you carefully as coach (#719) (督). It was uncomfortable, though, how your uncle (#718) often touched you just a little above the crotch (叔) when coaching...""<br>#718<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 督</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 督  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=719"">coach 監督</br></br></a>  Creepy uncle volunteers as gymnastics coach so he can eye the team from below.<br><br> ""Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your UNCLE was full of loneliness (#720) (寂), and he lived by himself. He was naturally graceful (#721) (淑) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team. You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he watched over you carefully as coach (#719) (督). It was uncomfortable, though, how your uncle (#718) often touched you just a little above the crotch (叔) when COACHing...""<br>#719<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 寂</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 寂  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=720"">loneliness さびしい</br></br></a>  The unmarried uncle's house is the picture of lonlieness.<br><br> ""Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your UNCLE was full of loneliness (#720) (寂), and he lived by himself. He was naturally graceful (#721) (淑) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team. You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he watched over you carefully as coach (#719) (督). It was uncomfortable, though, how your uncle (#718) often touched you just a little above the crotch (叔) when coaching...""<br>#720<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 淑</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 淑  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=721"">graceful</br></br></a>  ""Uncle (the one who is lonely and coaches kids in his spare time) is actually a graceful guy once he hits the water, as he used to be part of the swimming team in his youth.""<br><br> ""Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your UNCLE was full of loneliness (#720) (寂), and he lived by himself. He was naturally graceful (#721) (淑) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team. You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he watched over you carefully as coach (#719) (督). It was uncomfortable, though, how your uncle (#718) often touched you just a little above the crotch (叔) when coaching...""<br>#721<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 反</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 反  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=722"">anti-</br></br></a>  ""I think of an anti-hero (Dirty Harry etc.) for this primitive, whose trademark for disposing of villians is not an honorable fight, but a kick in the crotch and then a shove off a cliff (perhaps whilst the villain's back is turned).""<br><br> Many cultures are so anti-sex you'd think they just want people to throw their crotches over a cliff.<br>#722<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 坂</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 坂  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=723"">slope</br></br></a>  ""As the villain (pushed off by the anti-hero) is tumbling down the slope, he activates gadget skis to escape, spraying soil everywhere as he flies down the slope.""<br><br> ""This kanji depicts a classic enviornmental problem: erosion. Erosion occurs when all of the soil washes of the side of the cliff, eventually causing the cliff to disappear, leaving a slope (an anti- cliff if you will) in its place.""<br>#723<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 板</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 板  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=724"">plank</br></br></a>  ""Of course, trees are anti-plank. Wouldn't you be if you were a tree?""<br><br> ""Trees are naturally opposed to, or anti, the making of planks.""<br>#724<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 返</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 返  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=725"">return かえす</br></br></a>  Pretty obvious: to return is to turn back on the road you're on and go the opposite way.<br><br> ""In """"The Return of the anti-hero"""", Clint Eastwood kicks the villain in the crotch, pushes them off the cliff and onto a busy highway. A tiring movie franchise to say the least....""<br>#725<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 販</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 販  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=726"">marketing 販売　はんばい</br></br></a>  The goal of marketing is to get people who are naturally anti-buying to spend their shells (money).<br><br> ""『MARKETING: MONEY, ANTI』 The wide presence of MARKETING in our society has led people to become ANTI-MONEY.""<br>#726<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 爪</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 爪  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=727"">claw</br></br></a>  A pictograph of Wolverine's adamantium claws.<br><br> ""Pictograph, see book. * I prefer the primitive meaning of an eagle rather than vulture. Somehow vulture makes me think more about meat and dead corpses than claws. An eagle however immediately brings to my mind the image of an eagle plunging into a stream catching fish in his claws, or that of the great eagles rescuing Bilbo and his party in Jrr Tolkien's novel “Bilbo the Hobbit”.""<br>#727<br></span>"

Story: As you go to pick your nose, your parent grabs your finger and pulls it away (& gives you a lecture on social etiquette). The murder scene: peering through the window of a house, you see a gruesome murder scene. Human legs dangling from a ceiling fan, an elbow sticking out of a wall, and a heart still beating on the carpet.""<br><br> ""A photographer is at home, recovering his broken human legs. Your infant has been allotted human legs"""". Parent to be: """"Thanks a lot!"""".""<br><br> ""In China, to prevent too many human legs walking around, couples are alloted only one infant…　RTK2:　ジュウ　補充　ほじゅう(supplement)…　Semi-Pure Group:　銃762　(ﾄｳ): 統1347.""<br>#761<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 銃</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 銃  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=762"">gun じゅう</br></br></a>  """"""Everyone is allotted a metal gun"""" (US constitution according to the NRA).""<br><br> What is a gun but a device for allotting pieces of metal? One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...etc.<br>#762<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 硫</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 硫  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=763"">sulfur 硫黄(いおう)</br></br></a>  ""Sulphur is like a rock, but it can stink like a stream of infant doodie.""<br><br> Infants are baptised in streams inorder to prevent their descent into a place of sulphur and brimstone.<br>#763<br></span>"

His suit is always stained of red blood at the elbows and lower legs (this to help create an image that distinguish the two elements).""<br><br> <br>#765<br></span>"

It's easy to imagine a legal prostitute tempting a man with her mouth.<br><br> Prostitutes in Amsterdam have a license to show off their walking legs and tempt customers with their mouths.<br>#766<br></span>"

Now you can leave the desert! (Note: giving this primitive the meaning 'cactus' can be useful later).""<br><br> The exit lays between these two mountains.<br>#767<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 山</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 山  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=768"">mountain</br></br></a>  ""Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive this element appears equally as well at the top or bottom of the kanjis (besides appearing to the left). Since a mountain often brings to mind towering peaks, I will consider it implied that the element is placed at the top of the kanji. When this primitive appears at the bottom, I will arrange my story in a way that other elements are said to be at the very top of the mountain (see FRAME 775 for an example).""<br><br> YOU CAN'T POSSIBLY NEED A MNEMONIC FOR THIS!!!!<br>#768<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 拙</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 拙  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=769"">bungling&nbsp;せつ</br></br></a>  <br><br> Horror movie cliche 769: Bungling victim's fingers fumble & bungle trying to open the exit door.<br>#769<br></span>"

Think snowball effect, even if it wouldn't work with rocks.""<br>#770<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 岐</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 岐  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=772"">branch off&nbsp;ちまた</br></br></a>  ""On the left, there are three mountains. The road branches off to each of them. (Note: This kanji is mostly used for branches in the road).""<br><br> ""In a lot of Super Nintendo-era RPGs, there are mountain levels to get through. You view them from overhead, so you can see a mazelike path with many branches. Picture your sprite characters at one such fork in the mountain path, as it branches off in two directions.""<br>#772<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 峠</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 峠  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=773"">mountain peak/pass</br></br></a>  ""Heisig mentions at kanjiclinic.com that he wishes he'd chosen mountain pass for this keyword as it's closer to what the word means. If we do this, the kanji makes complete sense because a mountain pass is just below the mountain top.""<br><br> ""To the north of Lorien lies the Misty Mountains, and below their towering peaks are the Mines of Moria. The Fellowship of the Ring first tried for the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes above, but were halted by the wizardry of Saruman at Caradhras, and so are forced to take the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes below, through the mountain - a path long feared by Gandalf for the ancient evil that lurks there. Note : the kanji does in fact refer to a """"mountain pass"""".""<br>#773<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 嵐</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 嵐  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=777"">storm あらし</br></br></a>  Storm is a full-blown wind that rips the mountains off the ground (you see one flying here).<br><br> ""Winds are gathering at the base of the mountain (note the hint to primitive placement), going up, and turning into a huge mountain storm.""<br>#777<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 崎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 崎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=778"">promontory</br></br></a>  ""This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with mountain in place of soil. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives stone and strange. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which promontory is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names.""<br><br> ""A promontory is a small, strange mountain that juts out into the sea.""<br>#778<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 入</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 入  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=779"">enter</br></br></a>  ""Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive, using the image of going through a door, even one that stands alone with the frame and no wall around, helps flesh out the primitive “enter”.""<br><br> Person enters stage left…　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　ニュウ　入院　にゅういん(admittance into a hospital).<br>#779<br></span>"

It's important to understand that were you to enter an hour with a dagger and cut it into parts, those parts would be minutes.""<br>#781<br></span>"

So, he's caught a pigeon and is using it to wipe his bottom. (note the feathers on the bottom of the kanji, this helps remember placement).
