"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 厳</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 厳  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1936"">stern きびしい</br></br></a>  ""This represents a stern looking owl, perched up on a cliff. This cliff is quite famous for daring individuals to cliff dive off of, but is any of them daring enough to threaten the owl?""<br><br> ""The daring mouse gets a stern look after he climbs onto the owl's cliff...　RTK2:　ゲン　厳禁　　げんきん　(""""Strickly Prohibited!"""")　　　　　　　　　　　ゴン　華厳経　けごんギョウ(Avatamsaka Sutra).""<br>#1936<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鎖</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鎖  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1937"">chain くさり</br></br></a>  The chain on this chainsaw is made of little metal shells.<br><br> A gold chain with small seashells hanging on it is in fashion these days.<br>#1937<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 挙</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 挙  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1938"">raise</br></br></a>  This is a special owl-luring tool. All you need is to raise it in your hand. Owls will come flying and perch on it right away.<br><br> ""The owl was asked to raise his hand if he needed anything, but he had a wing, not a hand! So he made a tool that looked like a hand which he used when he needed to raise his hand. For raiseing, owl has a tool hand.""<br>#1938<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 誉</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 誉  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1939"">reputation</br></br></a>  This owl's reputation skyrocketed after he created a tool in order to speak human words.<br><br> <br>#1939<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 猟</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 猟  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1940"">game hunting</br></br></a>  ""[game-hunting; shooting; game; bag] According to unicode.org and wwwjdic, 鼡 and 鼠 (mouse (#2065)) are variants. So, for 鼡 (which I'll call rat) I have: an owl, flying in the wind, can easily spot a rat even if it's hiding in the cornstalks. Now 猟 is easy: wild dogs are having fun by game-hunting rats.""<br><br> The WILD DOGS are GAME HUNTING the OWL who flies like the WIND through the CORN STORKS.<br>#1940<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鳥</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鳥  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1941"">bird とり</br></br></a>  There is only one bird with such beautiful white tail feathers: the albino peakcock.<br><br> The BIRD let loose a WHITE ONE from it's TAIL FEATHERS...right on my new car!<br>#1941<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鳴</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鳴  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1942"">chirp</br></br></a>  A chirp is quite simply the sound that comes from the mouth of birds.<br><br> ""This kanji is not limited to the chirp of a bird, but stands for the sound of any kind of animal. Picture a very weird bird that can imitate with its mouth (a bird with mouth, heh) the voice of many different animals: Meeow! Woof! Mooo! Cuack!!! (Maybe the bird has Kirby powers and obtains the abilities of the animals it eats).""<br>#1942<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鶴</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鶴  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1943"">crane つる</br></br></a>  ""The original version of the """"Ugly Duckling"""" was about a crane who grew up in a turkey coop. All the other birds made fun of it for not having a wattle or a snood or fanning its tail...""<br><br> ""Do you know how cranes came to be? Well, they used to keep the poor bird cooped all the time. But the crane really wanted to be free, so it would always streatch its head and neck out of the coop trying to be free.""<br>#1943<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 烏</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 烏  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1944"">crow&nbsp;からす</br></br></a>  ""The book's story is just fine, but I found a kanji dictionary explanation also interesting: As crows are all black, it's hard to see where their eyes are (black on black), so a stroke is removed from the part in the pictograph where the eyes would be.""<br><br> ""A crow is a bird, but not a white one. MEANING: write bird, but skip writing one in white.""<br>#1944<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 蔦</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 蔦  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1945"">vine</br></br></a>  In the jungle there is a flowery vine called hedera rhombea that attracts humming birds by the dozens. They scoot around the flowers sucking up nectar off the vine.<br><br> <br>#1945<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鳩</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鳩  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1946"">pigeon はと</br></br></a>  Feed one pigeon and nine more birds will be swarming you immediately…　RTK2:　On list of rare or no official Chinese reading.<br><br> Imagine some pigeons going to see a baseball game. They would surely be the only birds there!<br>#1946<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鶏</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鶏  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1947"">chicken</br></br></a>  The vulture's husband is a chicken...heck...who am I to judge their interspecies love? They're both birds so its cool.<br><br> <br>#1947<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 島</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 島  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1948"">island しま</br></br></a>  This island is the home of the terrible mythical bird Roc. It sits mighty atop the mountain waiting for the next hapless ship to pass by.<br><br> Birds living on remote mountainous islands have few preditors. Tail feathers aren't really needed are they? Evolutionary process at work!...　RTK2:　トウ　半島　はんとう(peninsula).<br>#1948<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 暖</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 暖  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1949"">warmth あたたかい</br></br></a>  Ducks migrate south for the winter... they follow the warmth of the sun.<br><br> ""A massive group of migrating ducks is blocking the warmth of the sun as they pass over your house/barbecue/picnic. Their formation is so humongous they block the warmth for a good 10 minutes while they pass over. Mnemonic for the migrating ducks primitive : the migrating ducks stick together like the best of friends, flying together as one (fifth stroke), they are not easy prey for the great eagles / vultures.""<br>#1949<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 媛</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 媛  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1950"">beautiful woman えひめ</br></br></a>  ""As I saw the most beautiful woman on Earth, a flock of migrating ducks passed by and let their poop fly. That just ruined the moment...""<br><br> ""You want to know about a beautiful woman? There's a woman that's so beautiful, the birds migrate to her instead of the sun!""<br>#1950<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 援</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 援  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1951"">abet (encourage/assist esp. a crime)</br></br></a>  You abet the escape of migrating ducks by pointing them the way.<br><br> <br>#1951<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 緩</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 緩  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1952"">slacken ゆるい</br></br></a>  ""Oh no Spiderman has some migrating ducks stuck in his web, he has to slacken it so they can get out.""<br><br> Spiderman is a slacken off. He lays around all day in the park watching migrating ducks...　RTK2:　カン　緩和　かんわ(mitigation).<br>#1952<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 属</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 属  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1953"">belong</br></br></a>  ""These bugs BELONG TO an extremist group promoting insect independence. They are parading the FLAG of their group, the Nationalist GNATS, and wearing explosives BELTS for their planned terrorist war.""<br><br> ""[WARNING: violent story] Two teams of insects are playing “capture the flag” (ala Unreal Tournament). All of them wear ammunition belts. Here you try to take the flag of the opponent team, when you are faced by an insect: “You’ll get our flag over my dead body!”. You reply: “All your base are BELONG to us!”, shoot him on the head, take the flag and run away. See the drop of blood flowing from his head?""<br>#1953<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 嘱</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 嘱  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1954"">entrust ぞくる</br></br></a>  ""The commando gnats entrusted their mouths to the translators and what came out was """"All your base are belong to us!"""".""<br><br> <br>#1954<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 偶</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 偶  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1955"">accidentally 偶然</br></br></a>  ""Mr. T accidentially stepped on Jiminy Cricket (a brainy insect, with a belt sort of sash to hold his """"conscience"""" badge).""<br><br> ""Mr. T accidentally steps on Jiminy Cricket. // Primitive: right side: Talking cricket = Jiminy Cricket, a brainy insect with a belt to whip little kids who misbehave.""<br>#1955<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 遇</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 遇  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1956"">interview</br></br></a>  <br><br> On the road to my interview I accidentally bump into Jiminy Cricket who gives me some good advice. <br>#1956<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 愚</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 愚  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1957"">foolish</br></br></a>  """"""Don't be foolish!"""" says Jiminy Cricket as he lashes you with his belt. Follow logic, like me, not your heart.""<br><br> ""I simply imagine Jiminy Cricket jumping all over the place, like a mad man, yelling """"yeeeeehaaaaa!"""". Maybe he just fell in love? Mnemonic - """"Jiminy Cricket has a foolish heart"""".""<br>#1957<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 隅</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 隅  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1958"">corner すみ</br></br></a>  Jiminy Cricket has a favorite corner he likes to slip into at The Pinnacle for a long drink.<br><br> Oh how the pious fall from their lofty pinnacles! Jiminy Cricket now deals drugs on the street corner.<br>#1958<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 逆</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 逆  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1959"">inverted</br></br></a>  There's a road that's been inverted- it's gone from horizontal to directly vertical! The only beast that could possibly climb it is a mountain goat of course.<br><br> ""This reminds me of a cartoon I saw once, perhaps it was with Donald Duck. he is startled and furious when he chases this mountain billygoat further and further up the mountain road, untill the angle is so steep that he finds himself inverted. And falls down, while the goat stands solidly placed inverted and laughs a goaty laughter as Donald plumments and makes that typical Donald shaped cartoon crater at the bottom.""<br>#1959<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 塑</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 塑  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1960"">model そ像</br></br></a>  <br><br> <br>#1960<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 岡</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 岡  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1961"">Mount</br></br></a>  ""White mount , Fuji mount , olympus mount whatever ....The choice is yours but wherever you go they sell those snowglobe souvenir : under a GLASS HOOD you can see the mount with a MOUTAIN GOAT standing on top of it .... So kitsch you just can't forget it .""<br><br> <br>#1961<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鋼</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鋼  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1962"">steel はがね</br></br></a>  Mount Fuji is completely made up of a metal known as steel.<br><br> Ancient shamans predicted a time when there would be Mounts made of metal. The steel skyscrapers of today…　　　　　　　　RTK2: 　コウ　鋼鉄　こうてつ(steel)…　Semi-Pure Group:　綱1963　(ｺﾞｳ): 剛1964.<br>#1962<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 綱</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 綱  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1963"">hawser/rope つな</br></br></a>  Spiderman saves Japan from floating away by tying Mt. Fuji to mainland Asia using a hawser made of web.<br><br> <br>#1963<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 剛</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 剛  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1964"">sturdy</br></br></a>  ""Mount everest is very sturdy, you can hit it all day with a saber and it wont even wobble.""<br><br> ""Anything sturdy in Japan is associated with Mount Fuji. Perhaps this is because it's symmetry is believed to make it rather sturdy itself, unlike all those crooked mountains that are around and tend to fall apart (think rock slides, avalanches, etc.). Here we see Sturdy-brand sabers with Mount Fuji engraved on the blade.""<br>#1964<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 缶</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 缶  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1965"">tin can</br></br></a>  <br><br> ""The starving horse, stranded on the mountain, is forced to eat a tin can."" <br>#1965<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 陶</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 陶  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1966"">pottery</br></br></a>  ""At The Pinnacle, traditional pottery is done by binding up a bunch of tin cans into whatever pot shape desired.""<br><br> <br>#1966<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 揺</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 揺  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1967"">swing ゆれる</br></br></a>  I keep swinging gleefuly on the talons of the soaring condor until he slices off my fingers and sends me plummeting.<br><br> ""For the condor primitive: A condor is like a vulture, but twice as big and it lives near mountains (a suitable place for such a majestic bird). For swing: I'm sitting on a swing when a condor comes by and picks up the whole swing set with its big finger-like claws and now I'm swinging in mid-air. Weeeeeeeee!!!!!""<br>#1967<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 謡</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 謡  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1968"">Noh chanting うたい</br></br></a>  ""Noh chanting?!? I meant """"NO CHANTING!"""" Now all you, just shut up! Not another word! Don't you know that chanting can provoke attacks from the local condor? So, no chanting, and especially no Noh chanting.""<br><br> <br>#1968<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 就</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 就  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1969"">concerning</br></br></a>  In the capital they have been having hearings concerning bioethics and bioengineering they call as their first witness a chihuahua with one human leg.<br><br> ""Ahem...CONCERNING your recent science fair project, it was a CAPITAL idea, but the CHIHUAHUA with a HUMAN LEG is freaking out the other contestants!""<br>#1969<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 懇</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 懇  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1970"">sociable</br></br></a>  ""The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He's a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a """"heart of gold"""" he has a heart of silver (since he always finishes second in the game of love).""<br><br> ""The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He's a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a """"heart of gold"""" he has a heart of silver.""<br>#1970<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 墾</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 墾  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1971"">groundbreaking かいこん 開墾</br></br></a>  <br><br> <br>#1971<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 免</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 免  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1972"">excuse </br></br></a>  ""Obviously this is the rabbit from Alice, excusing himself and rushing away on his legs, as he has a binding day schedule. This is at the same time an image, with bound=ears, day=head and legs are just legs. The image is used in rabbit (#2093).""<br><br> What is the rabbit's excuse for being such a jerk? Well he was bound up for a whole day while being stepped on by peoples human legs in some make-up labratory. Yeah I think I can excuse him after knowing that.<br>#1972<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 逸</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 逸  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1973"">elude</br></br></a>  ""Tip : as a primitive rabbit becomes Bugs Bunny of Looney Tunes fame. Here Bugs Bunny eludes Elmer Fudd the hunter, once again.""<br><br> Bugs Bunny eludes Elmer Fudd by pretending to be roadkill.<br>#1973<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 晩</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 晩  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1974"">nightfall ばん</br></br></a>  At nightfall the sun excuses itself and goes to sleep.<br><br> ""Imagine Bugs Bunny halfway sticking out of a rabbit hole, somewhere in Japan, taking in the sun, when all of a sudden, night falls. Our """"sun-loving rabbit"""" burrows his way into the earth and pops out on the other side of the planet (say somewhere in America) and there it is, the sun high and bright in the sky! Thus, whenever it is nightfall you can be sure our """"sun-loving rabbit"""" is taking in the sun somewhere else accross the globe.""<br>#1974<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 勉</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 勉  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1975"">exertion べん強</br></br></a>  Notice how BUGS BUNNY's legs (hint about stroke extension) are starting to get big MUSCLES? It must be because he's always EXERTING himself on the run from Elmer Fudd (or from kicking the shit out of Elmer Fudd when he catches up!!).<br><br> Hint: Energizer bunny.<br>#1975<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 象</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 象  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1976"">elephant しょう</br></br></a>  ""An elephant has huge ears, like a rabbit, and a big, fat body, like a sow.""<br><br> ""An animal with huge ears like a rabbit, and a body fat like a pig... ¡An ELEPHANT! For the """"phenomenon"""" connotation you could use Dumbo, or Joseph Merrick (the """"elephant man"""") ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Merrick ).""<br>#1976<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 像</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 像  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1977"">statue</br></br></a>  The statue of liberty is being replaced by a statue of Mr. T riding an elephant.<br><br> ""In India, you see a lot of statues of the Hindu god Ganesha. Easy to recognize: he's the person with the elephant head.""<br>#1977<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 馬</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 馬  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1978"">horse うま</br></br></a>  ""Turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added (this matches stroke order and there are the tail feathers already, why not have the whole bird). If you take the two drops of 隹 as wings, then horses are like turkeys, but have no wings and have more prominent tail """"feathers"""". Both are actually supposed to be pictographs, though.""<br><br> ""The top part is half a comb (see frame 1920) with an extra vertical stroke to account for a sturdier version used to comb a horse mane. As a primitive I used the theme of the Trojan Horse. Not the modern computer viruses, but the large wooden horse which led to the demise of Troy and of the Trojans. Either its size (much greater than a live horse), or the fact that it conceals things into its belly, will set it appart from the horse primitive that came in frame 568 (""""noon"""").""<br>#1978<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 駒</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 駒  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1979"">pony こま</br></br></a>  ""The cute little innocent-looking plastic pony on the desk of a student is in fact a trojan horse, hiding phrases in its belly which are used for cheating during an exam. No pony will be permitted on desks during tests!""<br><br> ""A particular My Little Pony has a string that when you pull it, it repeats the same dumb phrase like """"I love you"""".""<br>#1979<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 験</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 験  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1980"">verification ためし</br></br></a>  We just need verification that there are indeed no soldiers in the belly of this trojan horse. We're just gonna stab it in the belly with this awl to check.<br><br> The verification proves the horse is real by poking it with an ice pick.<br>#1980<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 騎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 騎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1981"">equestrian きし</br></br></a>  ""If the equestrian team used trojan horses, it would be really strange.""<br><br> Equestrian events are where you get horses to do strange things.<br>#1981<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 駐</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 駐  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1982"">parking</br></br></a>  ""Parking in the dark may be difficult...specially if you're parking a trojan horse. To lend you a tiny bit of help, take this candlestick with you, and at least you'll have some light.""<br><br> <br>#1982<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 駆</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 駆  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1983"">drive かける</br></br></a>  You have to be craaazzzzyy to drive a cart led by a team of horses through a ward of Tokyo!<br><br> Wolverine drives his box by having a horse drag him around. He seems to really be losing it after coming to the homeless ward...<br>#1983<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 駅</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 駅  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1984"">station えき</br></br></a>  ""This reminds me of those infamous Mexican porn movies in which shakuhachi is performed on a horse. Here the deed is being done at a train station. As the passengers get off, so does the horse.""<br><br> ""Anyone living in Japan knows that train stations play little melodies when the train is about to arrive. In Ye Olden Days, when horses and carriages were used for transport, the carriage driver would play a little melody on his shakuhachi to let the passengers know the carriage was arriving at the next station.""<br>#1984<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 騒</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 騒  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1985"">boisterous</br></br></a>  ""The hidden Greeks inside the Trojan Horse are getting boisterous as one of them is bitten in the crotch by a nasty insect. If they don't shut up, the Trojans will hear them...""<br><br> <br>#1985<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 駄</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 駄  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1986"">burdensome だ目</br></br></a>  <br><br> ""If a passenger is too plump and heavy, its too burdensome for the horse.""<br>#1986<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 驚</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 驚  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1987"">wonder おどろく</br></br></a>  ""You stand in AWE at the 8th WONDER of the world, a huge TROJAN HORSE.""<br><br> ""This is another word for surprise. 驚く＝おどろく= surprise. The Trojans stood in awe of the magnificent Trojan Horse that they thought was a gift. But imagine their surprise (wonder) when a bunch of Greeks came rushing out of it! (To further cement the connection between the primitives, if needed: It's a wonder that the Trojans managed to speak keigo 敬語 even then, saying """"わたくしたちを殺さないでください!!お願い致します!!"""").""<br>#1987<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 篤</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 篤  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1988"">fervent</br></br></a>  ""A fervent horse doesnt need to be whipped with a bamboo stick during a race, it will go fast by itself.""<br><br> <br>#1988<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 騰</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 騰  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1989"">inflation</br></br></a>  ""Every quarter moon, the cost of a trojan horse rises one quarter by inflation.""<br><br> <br>#1989<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 虎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 虎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1990"">tiger</br></br></a>  ""Magic wand + first two strokes of pelt (皮) + diced + human legs. A wizard who turns people he doesn't like into newts with his magic wand goes for variety - he has always wanted a tiger pelt - but things go awry when the tiger promptly dices and eats him, leaving only a pair of legs. (a fitting end for a wicked wizard).""<br><br> ""Tigger, the tiger, (from Pooh stories) is happy to have found a magic wand. Using it he can bounce up to a the top of a cliff, seven times as high as some human legs could bounce. Tigger thinks """"Its great to be a tiger!""<br>#1990<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 虜</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 虜  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1991"">captive とりこ</br></br></a>  Captive men are thrown to the tigers. I think you can imagine something else is done to captive women...<br><br> ""Tip: To avoid confusing keyword captive with captured (#1018) note that captive contains """"ti"""" for tiger.""<br>#1991<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 膚</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 膚  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1992"">skin はだ</br></br></a>  ""Ending up in a tiger's stomach is not good for your skin, as it's full of stomach acids.""<br><br> TIGGER only has visible SKIN on his STOMACH. The rest of his body is covered in orange fur.<br>#1992<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 虚</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 虚  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1993"">void</br></br></a>  ""In Japanese folklore there is no hell, but there is the void. There, a row of tigers waits in the blackness to devour those souls who have failed in their spiritual life.""<br><br> Warning to Sigfreid and Roy: Your entertainment contract will be null and void unless you can make all the tigers stand in a row.<br>#1993<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 戯</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 戯  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1994"">frolic</br></br></a>  This is a story about the end of the universe. The universe is turning into a featureless void. There's nothing we can do about it except for throw a fiesta and frolic a little bit before it's all over.<br><br> ""Sigfreid and Roy's contract having been voided, the tiger is free to frolic about at the fiesta.""<br>#1994<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 虞</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 虞  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1995"">uneasiness おそれ</br></br></a>  The dentist couldn't help but feel uneasiness as he used his hand crank mouth tool on the tiger in his chair.<br><br> <br>#1995<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 慮</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 慮  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1996"">prudence/ponder</br></br></a>  ""Real meaning: """"to ponder"""". You have to think with prudence (ponder carefully) about approaching a tiger, as is evident from 虎.""<br><br> ""You have to think with prudence about approaching a tiger. If not, it will eat your brains and heart. Thanks raulir.""<br>#1996<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 劇</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 劇  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1997"">drama げき</br></br></a>  A great Indian drama acted out every year is how a poor Bengali boy fended off the tigers from his pigs using only a sabre.<br><br> ""If you thought """"The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe"""" was full of drama then you'll love """"The Tiger the Sow and the Sword"""".""<br>#1997<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 虐</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 虐  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1998"">tyrannize いじめる</br></br></a>  ""Here we see the evil tyrannizing tiger. What is on his chest? A giant E, for EVIL, of course.""<br><br> ""The """"E"""" shape actually means claws here, and the real etymology is a tiger tyrannizing other animals with its claws (the etymologies actually make sense once in a blue moon!). I think of the claws here as two hooks, representing the front paws. (stroke order of that part: 二＋last of 直).""<br>#1998<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鹿</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鹿  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1999"">deer</br></br></a>  Bambi wanders into a cave and sees a side order of salad and 2 spoons...but what's the main course?<br><br> ""Santa's reindeer, Rudolf, opens a nightclub in a cave. It's popular with all the deer and reindeer in the world. The cave speciality is a salad w/ dressing on the side. There is no other deer club that can compare. How many other deer nightclubs are there?""<br>#1999<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 薦</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 薦  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2000"">recommend すすめる</br></br></a>  <br><br> <br>#2000<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 慶</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 慶  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2001"">jubilation</br></br></a>  ""In this kanji, """"deer"""" replaces the """"head"""" primitive from the """"melancholy"""" kanji. Poor Ned is feeling melancholy so Uncle Jimbo (of South Park animated series) suggests a good deer huntin' trip to fix that and turn that melancholy into jubilation.""<br><br> <br>#2001<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 麗</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 麗  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2002"">lovely 綺れい</br></br></a>  ""The anthropologist made an exact deer painting from the cave ceiling on the ceiling of his house. Too bad they're both mediocre. All his wife could say was, """"How...lovely."""".""<br><br> Lovely bambi.... pictographe : just take a look at those innocent open eyes (part 1 it's not more far fetched than seeing mediocre in it) with thin eyebrows what a lovely deer ...(part 2).<br>#2002<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 熊</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 熊  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2003"">bear くま</br></br></a>  ""Most don't know it, but bears have the ability to walk on fire. They're invincible creatures!""<br><br> ""Note : I don't know why James Heisig put """"bear"""" ahead of """"ability"""" (next frame), but I sugget to skip this, learn the next kanji (""""ability"""") then go back here and use ability as a primitive.""<br>#2003<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 能</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 能  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2004"">ability</br></br></a>  ""The amputee has no hands but only stumps of flesh beneath his elbows. To give him the ability to eat he has two spoons implanted in his arm stumps, one in each side.""<br><br> ""Kid from the Oracle's place in the Matrix (whose head is shining like the moon) is holding a a spoon and making it bend using his special ability. When Neo asks to learn this ability the child replies, """" Remember the truth Neo, there is no spoon."""" Neo Proceeds to the kitchen pondering these words of wisdom. The Child smiles mischeviously and pulls a second spoon hidden up his sleeve in the crook of his elbow. """"That's right Neo,"""" the child laughs, """"there is no spoon...there are two spoons!"""".""<br>#2004<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 態</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 態  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2005"">attitude 態度</br></br></a>  ""This guy has an attitude problem – lots of ability, but his heart's not in it.""<br><br> ""Having a good attitude means believing in your heart that you have the ability to do anything - like memorizing more than 2000 kanji, for example.""<br>#2005<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 寅</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 寅  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2006"">sign of the tiger</br></br></a>  ""If you draw the sign of the tiger on the ceiling of your house, you will sprout tiger's legs (animal legs) and be able to run and pounce like the big cats yourself.""<br><br> <br>#2006<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 演</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 演  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2007"">performance</br></br></a>  That was some great performance! He caused the water to shoot up into the air and form the sign of the tiger in airborne droplets. You sure missed a great performance!<br><br> <br>#2007<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 辰</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 辰  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2008"">sign of the dragon</br></br></a>  Bruce Lee is such a badass he climbed a sheer vertical cliff using only 2 hairpins.<br><br> ""The kid said """"I don't believe you! Dragons don't exist!"""" so we made a little surprise for him: we pinned a huge dragon (it was just a sign really) on a nearby cliff. """"Whoaaa! Dragon!"""" the kid said. """"But why won't it move?"""" """"I tell you why, cause it's pinned there with two hairpins"""" I thought to myself.""<br>#2008<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 辱</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 辱  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2009"">embarrass</br></br></a>  <br><br> Bruce Lee is embarrassed when he does a high kick and splits his pants. He has to glue them back together.<br>#2009<br></span>"

He can conjure rain and earthquakes.<br><br> ""A la Kung Fu Hustle, Bruce Lee descends from the storm and causes an earthquake by smashing the ground.""<br>#2010<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 唇</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 唇  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2013"">lips</br></br></a>  ""I love Bruce Lee dubbing. His lips move, but sometimes words don't come out of his mouth.""<br><br> ""Bruce Lee says """"Read my lips..."""", but when I try to, his mouth isn't moving with the dialogue.""<br>#2013<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 農</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 農  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2014"">agriculture</br></br></a>  ""The most unlikely persons in the world to take up agriculture must be Bender and Bruce Lee. An awkwared moment as they stare on the various farming utensils, hoe, plow. Both with straw hats on and blue overalls, and drawn in Groenigs irrevent style.""<br><br> ""Bruce Lee is tough. But so is agricultural work. If Bruce took it up, even he would hurt his back from all the bending.""<br>#2014<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 送</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 送  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2016"">send off</br></br></a>  <br><br> ""The problem with the """"gold calf"""" primitive is that the first vertical stroke of """"heavenly"""" is shorter than the second stroke. But as we know, """"heavenly"""" clearly has the FIRST stroke longer, not the second. The primitives we really have here are """"animal horns (first 3 strokes)"""" and """"big/dog (last 3 strokes)."""" What are the BIGGEST ANIMAL HORNS that you can think of? For me its a MASTODON. STORY: In caveman times, you SENT OFF packages with the MASTODON express."" <br>#2016<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 関</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 関  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2017"">connection</br></br></a>  The golden calf is sent to the gates of Hell for it's connection to false idols.<br><br> There's a weird connection between worshipping the golden calf and visiting the gates of Hell.<br>#2017<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 咲</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 咲  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2018"">blossom さく</br></br></a>  Evil blossoms from the mouths of those who worship the golden calf. (Playing it safe and avoiding the image of a flower completely).<br><br> Blossom is an elegant euphemism for the precise part of the golden maiko that commands such a price in gold when she is 'deflowered'. (Along the lines of 'jade pillar' and 'lotus flower' in certain Asian texts.) [See my 2016-2018 for this sad tale.].<br>#2018<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鬼</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鬼  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2019"">ghost</br></br></a>  ""A ghost, or oni, wandering slowly on its human legs, searching for brains to eat. What looks like an elbow here is actually a pictoral representation of the forked tail protruding out of its rear.""<br><br> Ghosts aren't very intelligent - they have but a drop of brains - so can't tell the difference between an elbow and a pair of human legs.<br>#2019<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 醜</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 醜  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2020"">ugly みにくい</br></br></a>  The ugly oni can't get a date so he drinks sake by himself at the bar.<br><br> Drinking too much whisky can make you as ugly as an oni.<br>#2020<br></span>"

She smokes a lot of hemp, and spends the day talking to ghosts, which not surprisingly appears only to her.""<br>#2022<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 魅</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 魅  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2023"">fascination</br></br></a>  ""Ghosts have not yet left the world, they must still have a deep fascination with their past life on Earth.""<br><br> ""Here the """"Ghostbusters"""" founder talks about his fascination for ghosts (picture Dan Arkroyd in the movie if that helps). He says he has a fascination for ghosts ever since he saw one as a teenager. Since then he's been scouring all of the world, trying to capture them on tape, on video... A journalist asks """"When will it end ? Aren't you tired of chasing ghosts ?"""" """"Oh no, not yet ! Not until I become a ghost myself anyway !"""".""<br>#2023<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 且</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 且  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2034"">moreover</br></br></a>  ""Moreover is a literary term to shelve what you had just been talking about, to come back to it later.""<br><br> ""Same as darg_sama. Play on words. I imagine visiting someone who has an impressive collection of medals and trophies (chess champion, for example). After spending an hour showing you all the trophies in the glass shelf, you think """"Whew! It's over."""" ... but the person says """"... and wait, there's """"moreover"""" !"""", pointing at more trophies lined atop the glass shelf.""<br>#2034<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 藻</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 藻  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2035"">seaweed</br></br></a>  ""Let wooden goods = furniture. Then: Walking along the sea shore you see some washed-up furniture with water (waves) splashing against it. From a distance it looks like flowers are growing out the top, but as you get closer you see it is in fact seaweed.""<br><br> Take seaweed (water + flower) and hang it to dry in a tree to produce nori goods.<br>#2035<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 隷</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 隷  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2036"">slave</br></br></a>  The samurai sits on the altar and watches the slave rake rice all day.<br><br> The samurai from goodwill (#1097) maintains his good mood on his wedding day. He tells his slave that he can keep all rice (used for confetti) that he rakes up after the ceremony. Generous Man!!<br>#2036<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 癒</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 癒  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2037"">healing</br></br></a>  ""At the butcher's meeting, all the butcher's who have a heart disease attend the faith healing workshop.""<br><br> ""Note: meeting of butchers + heart are later combined into 愈 in the nick of time (#2433). Story: For healing to take place, you must catch the sickness in the nick of time.""<br>#2037<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 丹</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 丹  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2038"">cinnabar</br></br></a>  ""How about a rusty cinnabar colored dilapidated boat, found abandoned somewhere. The smoke-stack and the keel have fallen off...""<br><br> <br>#2038<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 潟</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 潟  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2039"">lagoon かた</br></br></a>  ""Right part: mortar bound up over oven fire, comprising boiling cauldron. Lagoon is a shallow pond, thus easily warmed by sun, large-scale equivalent of a boiling cauldron.""<br><br> I stapled both sides of some tail feathers to a waterfall towering over the lagoon to give it a more tropical feel…　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　On list of rare or no official Chinese reading.<br>#2039<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 此</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 此  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2043"">this here この</br></br></a>  ""I'm not going to use 'this here' as a primitive because it's too vague. But 'stop and sit down', usually tied to a tour guide explaining scenery works for me.//Stop and sit down to have a look at this here.""<br><br> ""A wildlife explorer, let's call him Steve Irwin, the sadly passed away wildlife expert, is tracking down an animal in a forest. He finds a footprint, and gets out a spoon to taste it. He scrapes the spoon over the floor and tries it. """"Now, this here is a crocodile footprint"""" he announces.""<br>#2043<br></span>"

(Ore)"""".""<br>#2058<br></span>"

I'd rather be whacked by bamboo staffs as I pass down an assembly line than do that. Of course, when a buddy wins, I'll go to the fiesta and enjoy the special salsa packed with green onions, but I will never play the lottery myself.""<br><br> <br>#2082<br></span>"

Oh, don't worry, it's just that little chihuahua with a human leg escaped from the lab, playing around in front of the flashlight.<br>#2089<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 采</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 采  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2090"">grab さい</br></br></a>  ""You ever wondered why this appeared as a primitive in so many RTK1 kanji? Well, you should know that once a vulture grabs hold of a tree, he can never let go. Even Heisig couldn't shake him loose.""<br><br> ""A common meaning for this kanji is 'DICE'. --- Ever wonder what vultures do up in the trees? They play DICE. But of course, being vultures, they are always grabbing the dice away from each other.""<br>#2090<br></span>"

It wasn't """"the"""" mouth of someone important on the floor at the fiesta, it was just a mouth of a common drunk.""<br><br> <br>#2091<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 倶</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 倶  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2124"">mate ともに</br></br></a>  """"""Oy, mate"""", the carpenter calls out to Mr. T, """"where did you leave my tools, mate?"""" Mr. T just hates it when people call him mate. It inspires him to misuse their tools.""<br><br> <br>#2124<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 侭</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 侭  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2125"">as is</br></br></a>  Mr. T is exhausted! As is the woman who just gave him shakuhachi.<br><br> <br>#2125<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 佑</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 佑  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2126"">adjutant</br></br></a>  An assistant is on Mr. T's left and an adjutant on his right. That's cause the adjutant can duck faster!<br><br> <br>#2126<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 俣</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 俣  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2127"">fork in a road</br></br></a>  ""Mr. T came to a fork in a road. He pondered which way he should go, when a large mouth appeared in the heavens above him and said """"Go west!"""" So, he went to California.""<br><br> <br>#2127<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 傭</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 傭  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2128"">hire</br></br></a>  ""I pity da foo' with no underlings! So, Mr. T hires some janitor to make his life more comfortable.""<br><br> <br>#2128<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 脩</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 脩  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2130"">dried meat</br></br></a>  ""Once again, Mr. T ventured out into the remote area to visit his old taskmaster (see permanence/remote (#958)). However, the old taskmaster has become very weak. His flesh looks like dried meat and his heart almost stopped (no heart). He stayed a whole month to take care about his former teacher.""<br><br> <br>#2130<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 倅</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 倅  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2131"">my son</br></br></a>  """"""My son"""", sniffs Mr. T, """"I'm so glad that you are now a college graduate"""" he said.""<br><br> <br>#2131<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 做</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 做  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2132"">make (someone) do</br></br></a>  ""Note that the meaning of this kanji is """"make (someone) do something"""", not """"get by with"""". Story: Mr. T doesn't rely on happenstance, he makes people do what he wants.""<br><br> <br>#2132<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 咳</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 咳  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2162"">cough せき</br></br></a>  ""I looked up, opened my mouth and suddenly an acorn fell in! I had to cough it up quickly so that I wouldn't choke.""<br><br> <br>#2162<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 喧</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 喧  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2163"">clamor</br></br></a>  To clamor means to open your mouth and proclaim loudly your opinions.<br><br> <br>#2163<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 喉</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 喉  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2164"">throat のど</br></br></a>  """"""If the marquis opens his mouth one more time, I'll cut his throat"""", his rival the baron said.""<br><br> <br>#2164<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 坤</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 坤  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2184"">autochthonous/earthy</br></br></a>  ""While """"autochthonous"""" can mean """"indigenous"""" in ENGLISH, that is NOT one of the potential meanings of this character (thus, the majority of these stories will not help you with meaning). Rather, the kanji is """"autochthonous"""" in the sense of being Earthly, mystic, and portentous (the ancient, primitive, sacred power of DIRT and SOIL). A vague, poorly-chosen keyword all around. Mantixen's story does the best job of conveying accurate meaning--> """"A monkey likes the earthy/autochthonous feel of soil"""".""<br><br> <br>#2184<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 姑</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 姑  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2205"">mother-in-law</br></br></a>  According to Japanese traditions, daughters-in-law have to pay respect to the woman who is their mother-in-law, because they are older.<br><br> <br>#2205<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 姐</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 姐  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2206"">young miss</br></br></a>  A young miss in a rich Japanese household is often treated with such care that she is a like a woman who is put on a shelf like an ornament.<br><br> <br>#2206<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 嬉</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 嬉  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2207"">overjoyed 嬉しい</br></br></a>  ""Finally, I got a woman ... I have to just shriek and rejoice, I'm so overjoyed!""<br><br> <br>#2207<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 孕</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 孕  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2208"">expecting</br></br></a>  A woman says to me “I’m expecting – there’s a child in here (pointing to her stomach)” I put my ear to her stomach and suddenly the child punches me – I see the shape of its fist in the stomach wall. “Well, you might be expecting, but I certainly wasn’t expecting that” I reply.<br><br> <br>#2208<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 孜</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 孜  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2209"">assiduous</br></br></a>  ""Well, yeah, the kid's assiduous: he's got that taskmaster on his back all the time! What else would you expect?""<br><br> <br>#2209<br></span>"

Now at least all my payments are going towards something solid, instead of just throwing it away as rent.""<br><br> <br>#2210<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 汰</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 汰  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2316"">cleanse/selection</br></br></a>  I couldn't find any reference to this kanji as meaning cleanse. It seems to be most often used in the following compound 沙汰（さた）to mean affair. The other meanings seem to be closer to 'select' so maybe Heisig meant cleanse in the ethnic sense here.. I'm going to use the keyword ""selection"", as in natural selection. Story: natural selection first began in the water, and those that were too plump were selected out.<br><br> <br>#2316<br></span>"

Iris is quite a bitch to ditch reed on the night of the prom!<br><br> <br>#2411<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 迪</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 迪  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2412"">Way</br></br></a>  ""Imagine a trail of brussel sprouts along a road. You follow it, picking up each sprout and eating it as you go along. Eventually, after the last sprout, you find your reward – a milky Way.""<br><br> <br>#2412<br></span>"

But lets intertwine their stories: The rabbit, who eluded capture (deviate/elude (#1973)) on the road, was finally caught when someone threw a shield over it.""<br><br> <br>#2416<br></span>"

""""If I'm gonna be sleeping with the fishes,"""" he said, """"can I at least have a pillow? I'm real sensitive."""" The mafia bosses laughed. """"Look, my doctor said I can only use wooden pillows, I have a real serious condition. Can I at least die comfortable-like?"""" The mafia dudes said fine, and let him have his pillow. They tossed him the river and drove off...and after a minute, he bobbed to the top, thanks to his floating wood pillow.""<br><br> <br>#2472<br></span>"

In such times, instead of simply standing up and inviting customers to make a deal, you must force the sale of your mandarin oranges by brandishing a halberd and forcing the customer to make a deal with you by purchasing your substandard fruit. [Note: along with 柚 citrus tree (#2482), this is used to describe all citrus plants - 柑橘類 かんきつるい means 'citrus fruit'.].""<br><br> <br>#2494<br></span>"

Hey, I tried.""<br><br> <br>#2495<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 碧</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 碧  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2588"">blue-green</br></br></a>  ""Notes: 珀 (not in Heisig) means """"amber"""". Story for both: A bus is stopped at some traffic lights in Japan. Inside, King Henry VIII and Barry White are arguing over whether the lights are yellow or amber. The lights change to """"Go"""", and Mick Jagger (stone) then joins a new argument over whether the lights are blue or green. They compromise on blue-green.""<br><br> <br>#2588<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 祇</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 祇  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2600"">local god</br></br></a>  ""From http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinto: Whenever a child is born in Japan, a local Shinto shrine adds the child's name to a list kept at the shrine and declares him or her a """"family child"""" (氏子 ujiko?). After death an ujiko becomes a """"family spirit"""", or """"family kami"""" (氏神 ujigami?). Therefore, if your family name is inscribed in the altar, then you will become a local god.""<br><br> <br>#2600<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 站</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 站  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2620"">outpost</br></br></a>  ""Stand up, fortune telling: Something scary happened at the Mars outpost near the alien ruins. Suddenly, one of the soldiers stood up and started to tell fortunes. (Which weren't all that positive for mankind). Then he fell down and never spoke again.""<br><br> <br>#2620<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 靖</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 靖  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2621"">repose</br></br></a>  Many repose peacefully in a blue vase after being cremated.<br><br> <br>#2621<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 妾</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 妾  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2622"">concubine/kept woman</br></br></a>  It's a concubine: feel free to touch (#672) her all you want.<br><br> <br>#2622<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 衿</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 衿  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2623"">lapel</br></br></a>  ""Cloak, clock: The cloaks of Muslims have a tiny clock on their lapel, so that they can keep track on when to pray...""<br><br> <br>#2623<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 裾</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 裾  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2624"">hem</br></br></a>  Something is residing in the hem of your cloak. Maybe you should consider cleaning it? キョ コ すそ cuff; hem; foot of mountain.<br><br> <br>#2624<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 袷</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 袷  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2625"">lined kimono</br></br></a>  ""Cloak, fit: The lined kimono was lined in such a way that it made people appear to be slimmer than they really were. Even people who didn't fit in the accompanying cloak still bought the lined kimono...""<br><br> <br>#2625<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 袴</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 袴  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2626"">pleated skirt はかま</br></br></a>  ""You can 誇 boast (#1244) with words, or you can instead show off your expensive cloak and hakama.""<br><br> <br>#2626<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 襖</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 襖  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2627"">sliding door</br></br></a>  ""The safety violations at Japanese nuclear power plants are egregious! Not only are they built inside ancient Japanese castles, there are no considerations for contamination. I was visiting last month when I opened a sliding door to reveal the cloak room. All the scientists had haphazardly piled their cloaks on the CORE itself!""<br><br> <br>#2627<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 笙</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 笙  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2628"">Chinese panpipe</br></br></a>  ""The Chinese panpipe is an old musical instrument made of bamboo. People practiced the Chinese panpipe their whole life just so that they could play for the emperor, often a bad performance would have the emperor take their life away from them.""<br><br> <br>#2628<br></span>"
