Then I can use them the next day.<br><br> <br>#2634<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 笥</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 笥  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2635"">wardrobe</br></br></a>  ""The film director is making a new low budget version of """"The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe"""". As we watch him, he appears to be constructing something out of bamboo. But well, what a problems she had getting those bamboo shoots into her mouth (which should not be that difficult, I would say!).""<br><br> <br>#2640<br></span>"

Of course, it might blow away so the postman has put heavy bamboo blocks on top of it.""<br><br> <br>#2645<br></span>"

If you don't already know the answer yourself, you shouldn't even ask.""<br><br> <br>#2646<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 粕</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 粕  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2648"">settlings</br></br></a>  Settlings at the bottom of sake are white and made of rice.<br><br> <br>#2648<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 綸</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 綸  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2656"">twine</br></br></a>  Spidey assists the older ladies at the twine convention by providing them with a continuous line of twine to knit with. They thank him for the twine with some wine.<br><br> <br>#2656<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 絨</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 絨  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2657"">carpet yarn</br></br></a>  ""Spiderman, burgler - money (burglar (#357)): When the old lady returned from visiting the fiesta, she found a burglar in her home tied up with carpet yarn. A note said: Regards from you friendly neighborhood Spiderman. Well, she was not amused when she saw the remains of her carpet.""<br><br> <br>#2657<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 絆</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 絆  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2658"">ties きずな</br></br></a>  ""Spiderman, half: Since only half of his family was left (aunt May, uncle died), Spiderman kept strong ties with her.""<br><br> <br>#2658<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 緋</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 緋  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2659"">scarlet&nbsp;緋色</br></br></a>  ""Spiderman is put in a jail cell by the fashion police for wearing scarlet. (His fellow inmates include Scarlet O'Hara, Scarlett Johansson, Captain Scarlet, The Scarlet Pimpernel, etc).""<br><br> <br>#2659<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 綜</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 綜  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2660"">synthesis</br></br></a>  ""Spiderman, religion: Spiderman discovered that the Scientology religion (which just opened a chapterhouse in his city) was a synthesis of idiotic beliefs and a little mystery. Everything to obtain large sums of money from its 'believers'.""<br><br> <br>#2660<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 紐</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 紐  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2661"">string</br></br></a>  ""A vegetarian replaces all his leather bootlaces with string, saying “There’s no sign of the cow in this thread!”.""<br><br> <br>#2661<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 紘</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 紘  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2662"">chinstrap</br></br></a>  ""Spiderman tries out for a football team. "<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 纏</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 纏  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2663"">summarize</br></br></a>  ""Spiderman, cave, computer, human legs, soil: To summarize the newest Spiderman comic: Spidy needs to turn off a computer in a cave (countdown clock for nuclear bomb). However, his human legs get stuck in the soil (some kind of quicksand). The situation seems hopeless... but somehow at the end of the comic, Spiderman has saved the day.""<br><br> <br>#2663<br></span>"

When he sees a hot babe, he whistles and calls, 'Hey, gorgeous, how'd you like to be bound up with Spidey for a decameron?' Viola, ruled lines are created! I bet most people think a machine does it.""<br><br> <br>#2698<br></span>"

It was the final step in preparation for a duel to the death.""<br><br> <br>#2699<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 袈</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 袈  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2700"">stole 大袈裟</br></br></a>  ""In Japanese RPGs, you are well advised to add a stole to your clothing as a """"freebie"""" way to add defensive points without swapping out some other garment. But since you can't find them in the shops, you have to """"stole"""" that stole from a glamorous NPC who is ostensibly there to aid your quest.""<br><br> <br>#2700<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 裟</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 裟  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2701"">monk's sash 大袈裟</br></br></a>  A monk's sash is a garment that has grains of sand in it from beachside meditations.<br><br> <br>#2701<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 戴</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 戴  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2702"">accept humbly 戴きたい</br></br></a>  ""At Thanksgiving, it’s uncommon for people to accept humbly the food: most people just dig in.""<br><br> <br>#2702<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 截</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 截  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2703"">incision</br></br></a>  ""I’ll do the honors! So, I grabbed the knife and made an incision into the Thanksgiving turkey.""<br><br> <br>#2703<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 哉</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 哉  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2704"">I wonder</br></br></a>  ""At Thanksgiving, there’s a pretty common bet: I wonder how much you can stuff into your mouth!""<br><br> <br>#2704<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 讐</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 讐  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2707"">vendetta</br></br></a>  ""In many Sicilian villages, when words are spoken which can never be taken back, a vendetta exists until this retribution - """"a turkey for a turkey"""" - can be extracted.""<br><br> <br>#2707<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 諌</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 諌  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2708"">remonstrate いさめる</br></br></a>  Words in the East remonstrate those who stand out.<br><br> <br>#2708<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 謎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 謎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2709"">riddle</br></br></a>  Words meant to lead you astray are those of a riddle.<br><br> <br>#2709<br></span>"

Gobble.. gobble.. gobble""""?""<br><br> <br>#2712<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 訊</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 訊  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2713"">query</br></br></a>  ""Word, needle, fishhook: The prisoner didn't speak a word in response to our query, so we got out our needles and fishhooks to get things going.""<br><br> <br>#2713<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 訣</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 訣  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2714"">split up けつべつ</br></br></a>  ""When you split up from your partner, you say words that cut things off for good, like a guillotine.""<br><br> <br>#2714<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 詣</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 詣  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2715"">visit a shrine 初詣</br></br></a>  ""To fat, effete Japanophiles (cheerily munching on 肉まん in the back of the tour bus) hearing the words of the tour guide """"Now we will visit a shrine"""" elicits squeals of joy. """"Oooooh, how absolutely delicious!"""".""<br><br> <br>#2715<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 諦</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 諦  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2716"">give up </br></br></a>  The words of the sovereign king inspire the people: never give up! Never surrender! Okay...maybe it wasn't a king.<br><br> <br>#2716<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 詑</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 詑  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2718"">prevarication</br></br></a>  ""In my house, when I prevaricate (say false words) my mother smacks me with a nasty big cooking spoon.""<br><br> <br>#2718<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 誼</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 誼  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2719"">familiarity</br></br></a>  ""After someone moves into the house next door, and after you give them a best regards gift (something they can fill their shelves with) the words you can now speak are those of familiarity. No more """"始めまして"""" ect.""<br><br> <br>#2719<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 謬</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 謬  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2720"">fallible</br></br></a>  ""Check-up (check-up (#1724)), feathers: When, during the check-up, I noticed that the doctor had feathers sticking out of different bodyparts, I decided that his diagnosis would be fallible, since he obviously was a nut.""<br><br> <br>#2720<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 詫</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 詫  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2721"">beg pardon お詫び</br></br></a>  """"""I'm going out with an otaku"""" """"I beg your pardon! What did you just say?!"""".""<br><br> <br>#2721<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 諏</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 諏  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2722"">advise</br></br></a>  You should take the words of someone who advises you with a grain of salt.<br><br> <br>#2722<br></span>"

When it turned out to be cancer, his words dried up quick.""<br><br> <br>#2725<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 諜</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 諜  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2726"">secret agent</br></br></a>  ""Words, generation, tree: You see that guy over there having words with that tree? That's a secret agent. And you see that tree there? That's a secret agent too: the new generation of secret agents is not limited to the human race anymore.""<br><br> <br>#2726<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 貌</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 貌  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2733"">countenance</br></br></a>  ""He counters, """"Your legs are so white, all I would have to do is apply some black and they would be the perfect countenance of a skunk!"""".""<br><br> <br>#2733<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 豹</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 豹  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2734"">panther</br></br></a>  Imagine that in the cartoon series the pink panther is in a dispute with a skunk. Picture the skunk filling a ladle with its stink liquid and then emptying it onto a snoozing pink panther.<br><br> <br>#2734<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 賎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 賎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2735"">despicable</br></br></a>  ""When they toss metal, that's all fine and dandy, but when those float people toss down shellfish, ugh!, that's just despicable!""<br><br> <br>#2735<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 貼</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 貼  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2736"">affix</br></br></a>  Fortune teller writes your fortune on a piece of paper and tells you to affix it to a shell and throw into the ocean for it to come true. Picture licking the back of the shell like a stamp and affixing it to the fortune.<br><br> <br>#2736<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 貰</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 貰  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2737"">get もろう</br></br></a>  You get money from the generation above you.<br><br> <br>#2737<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 賂</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 賂  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2738"">graft 賄賂</br></br></a>  ""It might sound simple to bribe someone, but then you have to graft the guy above him and the guy below him, and soon you're just giving shells to each and everyone!""<br><br> <br>#2738<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 賑</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 賑  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2739"">bustling</br></br></a>  Bruce Lee has money because he is always bustling about.<br><br> <br>#2739<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 躓</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 躓  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2740"">stumble</br></br></a>  ""At the border crossing, a man was trying to smuggle a controlled substance in his wooden leg. He would have made it too had he not stumbled and spilled the contents.""<br><br> <br>#2740<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 蹄</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 蹄  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2741"">hoof ひづめ</br></br></a>  ""After He lost a leg in combat, our sovereign king got a wooden leg as a replacement. Since He thought it was a little boring, he added a hoof for kicks. (Wow, that was totally unintentional, I like).""<br><br> <br>#2741<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 蹴</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 蹴  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2742"">kick</br></br></a>  The soccer player was concerned that his peg leg would affect his ability to kick.<br><br> <br>#2742<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 蹟</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 蹟  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2743"">vestiges</br></br></a>  The man who lost his leg in a accident now has to attach a wooden leg to the vestiges of his old leg. He only has himself to blame for drinking and driving.<br><br> <br>#2743<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 跨</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 跨  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2744"">straddle</br></br></a>  The amputee boasts about how the ladies just love to straddle his wooden leg.<br><br> <br>#2744<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 跪</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 跪  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2745"">kneel</br></br></a>  It's dangerous to kneel with a wooden leg. It might fall off.<br><br> <br>#2745<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 醤</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 醤  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2746"">soy sauce</br></br></a>  The leader's whiskey bottle is filled with soy sauce since he doesn't drink alcohol but likes to pretend he's one of the boys by making a strained face when he takes a swig.<br><br> <br>#2746<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 醍</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 醍  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2747"">whey 醍醐味</br></br></a>  ""When filling a whiskey bottle with a whey mixture, you've got to get the proportions just so or it will just taste like curdled milk.""<br><br> <br>#2747<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 酎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 酎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2748"">hooch &nbsp;焼酎</br></br></a>  ""While the keyword is """"hooch"""", this usually means 焼酎. It has similar effect as whiskey and sniffing glue has: you get intoxicated.""<br><br> <br>#2748<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 醐</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 醐  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2749"">ghee 醍醐味</br></br></a>  Drinking ghee out of a whiskey bottle is rather uncivilized (#2470).<br><br> <br>#2749<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 醒</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 醒  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2750"">awakening</br></br></a>  On awakening the first thing I notice is a (nearly empty) whiskey bottle by my bed. Then I see the stars are still shining. “I think I’ll go back to sleep and try awakening again later.”.<br><br> <br>#2750<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 醇</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 醇  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2751"">strong saké</br></br></a>  ""Whiskey bottle, receive: When you receive a bottle of whiskey from a Japanese person, large chance it is strong saké. It seems that giving 'sissy' saké is considered impolite.""<br><br> <br>#2751<br></span>"

I love these theme-restaurants!<br><br> <br>#2752<br></span>"

Needless to say, this is agony.""<br><br> <br>#2775<br></span>"

Today he predicts a (purple) haze.<br><br> <br>#2779<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 翰</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 翰  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2780"">quill</br></br></a>  ""How to obtain quills for free: Wait for a misty day, then under cover of the mist creep up on an unsuspecting bird and quickly cover it with your umbrella. The bird will flap around wildly trying to escape and while doing so will shed a number of feathers. You can use these as quills.""<br><br> <br>#2780<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 斡</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 斡  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2781"">auspices</br></br></a>  ""Under the auspices of the local observatory, we looked at the Big Dipper on a misty night, huddled under an umbrella.""<br><br> <br>#2781<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鞍</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鞍  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2782"">saddle</br></br></a>  A saddle is leather that helps you relax on horseback.<br><br> <br>#2782<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鞘</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鞘  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2784"">saddle straps さや</br></br></a>  ""Originally, the leather saddle straps were for holding candles, but now they're more commonly used for holding swords, like scabbards.""<br><br> <br>#2784<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鵜</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鵜  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2832"">cormorant</br></br></a>  ""[+brose] The cormorant was historically used in Japan and China to catch fish. The fisher would use some rope or something to tie its throat so that it could only swallow small fish. If it caught something too big to swallow, it would take it back to the fisher's boat and the fisher would take it out. This particular cormorant is going after bigger and bigger prey - but one day it goes too far, and tries to swallow your little brother! Imagine trying to yank your brother out of its throat.""<br><br> <br>#2832<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鷺</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鷺  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2833"">heron</br></br></a>  ""As I was walking I noticed hair-on the path! "<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 酋</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 酋  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2906"">chieftain</br></br></a>  Only the chieftain could drink horned whiskey since he was the one responsible for procreation.<br><br> <br>#2906<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 鴬</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 鴬  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2907"">nightingale</br></br></a>  The nightingale is a bird that goes to a schoolhouse at night to learn to sing.<br><br> <br>#2907<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 赫</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 赫  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2908"">incandescent</br></br></a>  ""Incandescent red is naturally twice as bright as ordinary red (赤). Alternatively, this is a picture of spreading (already doubled), incandescent red fire. Note: This is used by far most commonly to write 赫(あか)い, although dictionaries do not recognize such a reading (except for kanji dictionaries).""<br><br> <br>#2908<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 臥</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 臥  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2909"">supinate</br></br></a>  ""If a person has retainers, then he can spend his life supinate (i.e. lying on his back doing nothing). (note: for the writing order think: SuPinate = Slave-Person).""<br><br> <br>#2909<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 甥</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 甥  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2910"">nephew おい</br></br></a>  A nephew is someone you can watch grow into a man over his lifetime.<br><br> <br>#2910<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 瓢</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 瓢  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2911"">gourd</br></br></a>  ""I enter a ballot to try to win a melon, but end up with a gourd.""<br><br> <br>#2911<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 琵</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 琵  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2912"">biwa</br></br></a>  ""The two kings play their biwa, comparing each other's skill.""<br><br> <br>#2912<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 叉</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 叉  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2914"">forked</br></br></a>  ""Think of this as """"tuning fork"""" (音叉). Then, touching a vibrating tuning fork against a crotch causes it to drip drops.""<br><br> <br>#2914<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 舜</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 舜  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2915"">rose of Sharon</br></br></a>  Elton john takes off his birdhouse sunglasses as he winks and gives a rose to sharon.<br><br> <br>#2915<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 畠</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 畠  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2916"">dry field</br></br></a>  ""You see a white dove about to land in a paddyfield, and, believing that field to be under water, expect to hear a """"plop"""". But the plop doesn't come, so you think to yourself, """"Ah, that must be a dry field"""".""<br><br> <br>#2916<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 亮</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 亮  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2920"">translucent</br></br></a>  Let crown + human legs = Miss World. Then the very tall Miss World won the title due to her translucent dress.<br><br> <br>#2920<br></span>"

Then, when they lit the incense, a booming voice came out of nowhere: """"Hmmm... this smell is great, no, ambrosial. Really worthy of the Gods..."""".""<br><br> <br>#2925<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 牒</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 牒  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2926"">label</br></br></a>  ""Tip: New primitive: Let Tarzan = generation + tree -- because Tarzan lives with several generations of his family at the top of a tree. (This combination appears five times: leaf (#228), butterfly (#521), chatter (#2158), secret agent (#2726), label (FRAME 2926)). Story: You notice Tarzan is wearing his shirt inside-out and explain to him that clothes are one-sided and that he can tell by looking at the label.""<br><br> <br>#2926<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 阜</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 阜  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2928"">large hill</br></br></a>  The maestro lives on top of a large hill so that he can play music at over ten decibels without anyone giving a damn.<br><br> <br>#2928<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 睾</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 睾  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2929"">testicle</br></br></a>  Tip: primitives given in the book are: blood + happiness. But should be: drop + eye (/net) + happiness. Story: As you squeeze the last drop out of your testicles you go cross-eyed with happiness.<br><br> <br>#2929<br></span>"

When Perseus goes to rescue Andromeda, he finds he's made a mistake. What looked from a distance like a beautiful maiden chained to a rock turns out to be a St. Bernard tangled up in some ivy. "<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 赳</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 赳  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2936"">bold</br></br></a>  ""Run, cornucopia: The thief was bold, but stupid. He was running away with the cornucopia he just stole from the feudal lord. However, he was leaving an easy track to follow as the cornucopia was pouring out its riches. So, bold, but stupid.""<br><br> <br>#2936<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 粁</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 粁  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2946"">kilometer</br></br></a>  ""If you mark each meter with a grain of rice, after 1,000 grains of rice you have measured out a kilometre.""<br><br> <br>#2946<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 糎</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 糎  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2947"">centimeter</br></br></a>  A rin of a meter is a centimeter.<br><br> <br>#2947<br></span>"
"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 粍</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 粍  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2948"">millimeter</br></br></a>  The portion of a meter the width of fur is a millimeter.<br><br> <br>#2948<br></span>"

"<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 梵</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 梵  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2954"">Buddhist</br></br></a>  ""This is a Brahman, a fully enlightened one. He's sitting in front of a grove of trees, legs open (looks like wind), just meditating. You run up to him asking him all sorts of crazy questions, and he looks at you and smiles. """"Brah, man, just chill, man. Braaaaah#."""" Apparently he's a surfer brahman. You ask him the meaning of life, and he smiles, and waits...waits...waits...until a bit of wind blows by. He lets out a small fart in the wind, and nods knowingly at you.""<br><br> <br>#2954<br></span>"

The registrar - """"Okay, buddy, what are you selling?"""" """"Nothing,"""" he says. """"I am giving out physical products to entice true enlightment."""" """"Whatever, dude..."""" "<span style=""font-family: TakaoPGothic; font-size: 150px; ""> 龍</span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; "">"	"<span style=""font-family: KanjiStrokeOrders; font-size: 150px; ""> 龍  </span><br><span style=""font-family: Mincho; font-size: 22px; ""> <a href=""http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2981"">dragon [old]</br></br></a>  ""An ancient Japanese dragon, beautiful and terrifying. Here it is depicted standing on a piece of meat (its prey) and a description is written on the right margin. It is said to be like a snake that has three toes on its feet and can sometimes use its head as a flamethrower (kind of like a sling, but with fire instead of stones). (Note: The Japanese dragon has three toes, unlike other Asian dragons. Asian dragons generally don't breath fire, but Godzilla does, and it is supposed to be a dragon!).""<br><br> <br>#2981<br></span>"

I've been using Ninja Turtles and stuff though, so I'll have to use this as a series of narrow, long, lead pipes that bring floods of water to the city. Here, someone has taken a lead sewer pipe and hit you in the part of your flesh that is most vulnerable to impact: your shin (after years of soccer/football, I can't think of the word shin without thinking of pain).""<br><br> <br>#2989<br></span>"

"ジムが<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...plays]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>041 Basic Grammar - Verb Basics: Classifying verbs into ru-verbs and u-verbs</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"学校に行った？／行かなかった。／<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">図書館</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...to]</span>は？ ／<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">図書館</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...to also]</span>行かなかった。"	  <div class='notes'>091 Basic Grammar - Particles used with verbs: When location is the topic</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">先週に医者</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...past]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ボブ</span>は、仕事を辞めた。"	  <div class='notes'>105 Basic Grammar - Descriptive Subordinate Clauses and Sentence Order: Using state-of-being subclauses as adjectives</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">晩ご飯を食</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...did not]</span>人は、<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">映画で見</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...did]</span>銀行に行った。"	  <div class='notes'>109 Basic Grammar - Descriptive Subordinate Clauses and Sentence Order: Using subordinate verb clauses as adjectives</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"本<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...and]</span>雑誌<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...and]</span>葉書を買った。"	  <div class='notes'>111 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The Inclusive 「と」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"友達<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...together with]</span>話した。"	  <div class='notes'>112 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The Inclusive 「と」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"先生<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...together with]</span>会った。"	  <div class='notes'>113 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The Inclusive 「と」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"飲み物<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...and things like]</span>カップ<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...and things like]</span>ナプキンは、いらない？"	  <div class='notes'>114 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The Vague Listing <b>「や」</b> and 「とか」 particles</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"靴<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...and things like]</span>シャツを買う。"	  <div class='notes'>115 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The Vague Listing <b>「や」</b> and 「とか」 particles</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"飲み物<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...and things like (not や)]</span>カップ<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...and things like (not や)]</span>ナプキンは、いらない？"	  <div class='notes'>116 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The Vague Listing 「や」 and <b>「とか」</b> particles</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"靴<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...and things like (not や)]</span>シャツを買う。"	  <div class='notes'>117 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The Vague Listing 「や」 and <b>「とか」</b> particles</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"ボブ<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...possesive]</span>本。"	  <div class='notes'>118 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"ボブは、アメリカ<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...possesive]</span>大学<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...possive]</span>学生だ。"	  <div class='notes'>119 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"そのシャツは<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">誰</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...belongs to]</span>？／<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ボブ</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...'s]</span>だ。"	  <div class='notes'>120 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">白</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...not こと]</span>は、かわいい。"	  <div class='notes'>121 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">授業に行く</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...not こと]</span>を忘れた。"	  <div class='notes'>122 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">白</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[... thing]</span>は、かわいい。"	  <div class='notes'>123 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 replaced with もの　particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">授業に行く</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...not </span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">の</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">]</span>を忘れた。"	  <div class='notes'>124 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 replaced with こと particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"毎日<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">勉強</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...not </span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">こと​</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">]</span>は大変。"	  <div class='notes'>125 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"毎日<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">同じ物を食</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...not こと]</span>は、面白くない。"	  <div class='notes'>126 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">静</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><b>が、アリス</b><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...belongs to]</span><b>部屋だ。</b>"	  <div class='notes'>127 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"今は忙しい<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...it's that]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>128 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle as explanation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"今は忙しい<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...the thing is]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>129 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle as explanation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"今は忙しい<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...is it that]</span>？"	  <div class='notes'>130 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle as explanation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"ジム<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...it is his]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>131 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle as explanation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"ジム<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...it is</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;""> him</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">, explan.]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>132 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle as explanation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"どこに<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">行</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...is it that]</span>？／授業に<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">行</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...it's that, abbr]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>133 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle as explanation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"今、授業が<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ある</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...isn't it]</span>？／今は、ないんだ。"	  <div class='notes'>134 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles : The 「の」 particle as explanation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"今、授業が<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ない</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...isn't that]</span>？／ううん、ある。"	  <div class='notes'>135 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle as explanation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"その人が<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">買</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...Wasn't it]</span>？／ううん、先生が<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">買</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...is that]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>136 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle as explanation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"この町は、最近<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">大</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span>変わった。"	  <div class='notes'>143 Basic Grammar - Using Adverbs and Gobi: Properties of Adverbs</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"いい天気だ<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...huh?]</span>。／そう<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">isn't it</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>145 Basic Grammar - Using Adverbs and Gobi: The 「ね」 gobi</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"時間がない<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...you know]</span>。／大丈夫だ<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...you know]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>147 Basic Grammar - Using Adverbs and Gobi: The 「よ」 gobi</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"今日はいい天気だ<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...huh]</span>。／うん。でも、明日雨が降る<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...you know]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>148 Basic Grammar - Using Adverbs and Gobi: The 「よ」 gobi</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"田中さんは、<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">お金持</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span>、<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">かっこよ</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span>、魅力的ですね。"	  <div class='notes'>042 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing a sequence of states</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"食堂に<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">行</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span>、昼ご飯を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">食</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span>、昼寝をする。"	  <div class='notes'>043 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing a sequence of verbs with the te-form</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"食堂に<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">行</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span>、昼ご飯を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">食</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span>、昼寝をした。"	  <div class='notes'>044 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing a sequence of verbs with the te-form</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"時間が<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...there existed, polite]</span>、映画を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">見</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...past, polite]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>045 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing a sequence of verbs with the te-form</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"時間が<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...did not exist]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">から</span>パーティーに行きませんでした。"	  <div class='notes'>046 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using <b>「から」</b> and 「ので」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">友達</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...from]</span>プレゼントが来た。"	  <div class='notes'>047 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using <b>「から」</b> and 「ので」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">友達</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...because]</span>プレゼントが来た。"	  <div class='notes'>048 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using <b>「から」</b> and 「ので」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"どうしてパーティーに行きませんでしたか。／時間が<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...did not exist]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">からです</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>049 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using <b>「から」</b> and 「ので」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"パーティーに行かなかったの？／うん、時間が<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...did not exist]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">から</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>050 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using <b>「から」</b> and 「ので」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"時間がなかった。／<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">から</span>パーティーに行かなかったの？"	  <div class='notes'>051 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using 「から」 and 「ので」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"ちょっと<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">忙</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ので</span>、そろそろ失礼します。"	  <div class='notes'>052 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using 「から」 and <b>「ので」</b></div> Definitions:<br><br>そろそろ - gradually; soon<div>失[しつ] 礼[れい] - discourtesy</div>
"私は<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">学生</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ので</span>、お金がないんです。"	  <div class='notes'>053 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using 「から」 and <b>「ので」</b></div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"ここは<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">静</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ので</span>、とても穏やかです。"	  <div class='notes'>054 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using 「から」 and <b>「ので」</b></div> Definitions:<br><br>穏[おだ]やか - calm; peaceful
"<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ので</span>、友達に会う時間がない。"	  <div class='notes'>055 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using 「から」 and <b>「ので」</b></div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"時間が<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...did not exist]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">んで</span>パーティーに行かなかった。"	  <div class='notes'>056 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using 「から」 and <b>「ので」</b> abbreviated</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"ここは<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">静</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">んで</span>、とても穏やかです。"	  <div class='notes'>057 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using 「から」 and <b>「ので」</b> abbreviated</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...abbr,]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">んで</span>、友達に会う時間がない。"	  <div class='notes'>058 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing reason or causation using 「から」 and <b>「ので」</b> abbreviated</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"毎日<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">運動</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">のに</span>、全然痩せなかった。"	"  <div class='notes'>059 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Using 「のに」 to mean ""despite""</div> Definitions:<br><br>None"
"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">学生</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">のに</span>、彼女は勉強しない。"	"  <div class='notes'>060 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Using 「のに」 to mean ""despite""</div> Definitions:<br><br>None"
"デパートに<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">行[...polite]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">が</span>、何も欲しくなかったです。"	  <div class='notes'>061 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing contradiction using <b>「が」</b> and 「けど」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"友達に<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">聞</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">けど</span>、知らなかった。"	  <div class='notes'>062 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing contradiction using 「が」 and <b>「けど」</b></div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"今日は<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">暇</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">けど</span>、明日は忙しい。"	  <div class='notes'>063 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing contradiction using&nbsp;&nbsp;「が」 and <b>「けど」</b></div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""font-weight:600;color:#0000ff"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">けど</span>、彼がまだ好きなの。"	  <div class='notes'>064 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing contradiction using 「が」 and <b>「けど」</b></div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"デパートに<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">行[...polite]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">が</span>、いい物がたくさんありました。"	  <div class='notes'>065 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing contradiction using <b>「が」</b> and 「けど」(polite)</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"マトリックスを<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">見</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">けど</span>、面白かった。"	  <div class='notes'>066 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing contradiction using 「が」 and <b>「けど」</b></div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"どうして友達じゃないんですか？<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">先生</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">し</span>、<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">年上</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">し</span>・・・。"	  <div class='notes'>067 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing multiple reasons using 「し」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"どうして彼が好きなの？<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">優</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">し</span>、<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">かっこ</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">し</span>、面白いから。"	  <div class='notes'>068 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing multiple reasons using 「し」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"映画を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">見</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">り</span>、<span style=""color:#000000;"">本を</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">読[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">り</span>、<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">昼寝[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">り</span>する。"	  <div class='notes'>069 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing multiple actions or states using 「～たりする」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"この大学の授業は<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">簡単</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">り</span>、<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">難</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">り</span>する。"	  <div class='notes'>070 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing multiple actions or states using 「～たりする」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"映画を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">見たり</span>、本を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">読</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...past]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>071 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing multiple actions or states using 「～たりする」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"映画を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">見たり</span>、本を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">読</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...not]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>072 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing multiple actions or states using 「～たりする」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"映画を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">見たり</span>、本を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">読</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...did not]</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>073 Essential Grammar - Compound Sentences - Expressing multiple actions or states using 「～たりする」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"友達は何を<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...する]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">いる</span>の？昼ご飯を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">食</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">いる</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>074 Essential Grammar - Other uses of the te-form - Using 「～ている」 for enduring states</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"話を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">聞</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">います</span>か。／ううん、<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">聞</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">いない</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>076 Essential Grammar - Other uses of the te-form - Using 「～ている」 for enduring states</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"友達は何を<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...する, abbr.]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">る</span>の？／昼ご飯を<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">食</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...　abbr.]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">る</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>077 Essential Grammar - Other uses of the te-form - Using 「～てる」 abbreviation for enduring states</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"<span style=""color:#0000ff;"">何</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">言いましたか</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>201 Essential Grammar - Performing an action on a subordinate clause - The interpreted quote</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">宿題を</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">[...する, not]</span>、授業に行くのは、やめた方がいいよ。"	  <div class='notes'>217 Special Expressions - More negative verbs - Doing something without doing something else - ないで</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"彼女は朝早く起こされるのを<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">嫌[...]がるタイプ</span>です。"	  <div class='notes'>037 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Showing outward signs of an emotion using 「～がる」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"うちの子供はプールに入るのを理由もなく<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">怖[...]がる</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>038 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Showing outward signs of an emotion using 「～がる」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"家に帰ったら、すぐパソコンを<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">使[...]がる</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>039 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Showing outward signs of an emotion using 「～がる」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"みんなイタリアに<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">行[...]がってる</span>んだけど、私の予算で行けるかどうかはとても怪しい。"	  <div class='notes'>040 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Showing outward signs of an emotion using 「～がる」</div> Definitions:<br><br>よ‐さん【予算】 __あらかじめ算定すること｡また､その数量･金高など｡かねての目算｡
"妻はルイヴィトンのバッグを<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">欲[...]がっている</span>んだけど、そんなもん、買えるわけないでしょう！"	  <div class='notes'>041 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Showing outward signs of an emotion using 「～がる」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"私は<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">寒[...]</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">がり</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">屋</span>だから、ミネソタで暮らすのは辛かった。"	  <div class='notes'>042 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Showing outward signs of an emotion using 「～がる」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"ボールは<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">爆発[...</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">する</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">]ばかり</span>に、膨らんでいた。"	  <div class='notes'>043 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Using 「ばかり」 to act as if one might do something</div> Definitions:<br><br>ふくらむ【膨らむ】 swell (out); (風船などが) fill out; get big;
"「あんたと関係ない」と<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">言[...]ばかり</span>に彼女は彼を無視していた。"	  <div class='notes'>044 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Using 「ばかり」 to act as if one might do something</div> Definitions:<br><br>む‐し【無視】 存在や価値を認めないこと｡ないがしろにすること
"昨日の喧嘩で<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">何も言[...not, past]ばかり</span>に、平気な顔をしている。"	  <div class='notes'>045 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Using 「ばかり」 to act as if one might do something</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"そんな<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">謎[...]めいた</span>顔をされても、うまく説明できないよ。。"	  <div class='notes'>047 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Using 「めく」 to indicate an atmosphere of a state</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"いつも<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">皮肉[...]めいた</span>言い方をしたら、みんなを嫌がらせるよ。。"	  <div class='notes'>048 Advanced Topics - Showing signs of something - Using 「めく」 to indicate an atmosphere of a state</div> Definitions:<br><br>ひにく1【皮肉】　1 〔あてこすり〕 sarcasm; nastiness;
"このテレビがこれ以上壊れたら、新しいのを<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">買[...]を得ない</span>な。"	  <div class='notes'>049 Advanced Topics - Formal expressions of non-feasibility - Expressing the inability to not do using 「～ざるを得ない」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"ずっと我慢してきたが、この状態だと歯医者さんに<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">行[...]を得ない</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>050 Advanced Topics - Formal expressions of non-feasibility - Expressing the inability to not do using 「～ざるを得ない」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"上司の話を聞くと、どうしても海外に<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">出張を[...する]を得ない</span>ようです。"	  <div class='notes'>051 Advanced Topics - Formal expressions of non-feasibility - Expressing the inability to not do using 「～ざるを得ない」</div> Definitions:<br><br>しゅっちょう1【出張】 a business trip; an official 
"<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">やむ[...]を得ない事由</span>により手続が遅れた場合、必ずご連絡下さい。"	  <div class='notes'>052 Advanced Topics - Formal expressions of non-feasibility - Expressing the inability to stop doing something using 「やむを得ない」</div> Definitions:<br><br>じゆう2【事由】 a reason; a cause; a ground; conditions.<br />手続【てつづき】　(n,vs) procedure
"新しい仕事が見つからないので<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">やむ[...]を得ない状態</span>です。"	  <div class='notes'>053 Advanced Topics - Formal expressions of non-feasibility - Expressing the inability to stop doing something using 「やむを得ない」</div> Definitions:<br><br>ふけいき【不景気】 〔商業の〕 (commercial, economic, financial, business, trade) slump;
"この場ではちょっと<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">決[...]かねます</span>ので、また別途会議を設けましょう。"	  <div class='notes'>054 Advanced Topics - Formal expressions of non-feasibility - Expressing what cannot be done with 「～かねる」</div> Definitions:<br><br>べっ‐と【別途】　__別の道｡別の方面｡
"このままでは、<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">個人情報が漏洩[...する]かねない</span>ので、速やかに対応をお願い致します。"	  <div class='notes'>055 Advanced Topics - Formal expressions of non-feasibility - Expressing what cannot be done with 「～かねる」</div> Definitions:<br><br>ろうえい2【漏洩】 (a) disclosure; divulgence; a leak.<br />すみやか【速やか】 ～な rapid; speedy; prompt;<br />たいおう1【対応】 4 〔処理･応対〕 response; reaction; treatment.
"確定申告は<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">忘[...]がち</span>な手続のひとつだ。"	  <div class='notes'>056 Advanced Topics - Tendencies - Saying something is prone to occur using 「～がち」</div> Definitions:<br><br>かくていしんこく【確定申告】 a final (tax) ┌return [declaration].<br />かくてい3【確定】 a decision; a settlement;<br />しんこく1【申告】 a tax <br />てつづき【手続き】 【電算】 〔サブルーチン〕 a procedure.
"<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">留守[...]がち</span>なご家庭には、犬よりも、猫の方がお勧めです。"	  <div class='notes'>057 Advanced Topics - Tendencies - Saying something is prone to occur using 「～がち」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"体に<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">よくないと思[...]つつ</span>、最近は全然運動してない。"	  <div class='notes'>061 Advanced Topics - Tendencies - Describing an ongoing occurrence using 「～つつ」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"電気製品の発展につれて、ハードディスクの容量はますます<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">大きく[...</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">なる</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">]つつある</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>062 Advanced Topics - Tendencies - Describing an ongoing occurrence using 「～つつ」</div> Definitions:<br><br>ますます【益々】 more and more
"今の日本では、雇用慣行が<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">崩[...]つつある</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>063 Advanced Topics - Tendencies - Describing an ongoing occurrence using 「～つつ」</div> Definitions:<br><br>終身雇用 lifetime employment.<br />しゅうしん3【終身】 for life; all (through) one's life.<br />こよう3【雇用】 employment.<br />ねんこうじょれつ【年功序列】 seniority; a seniority system.<br />ねんこう1【年功】 〔勤続〕 long [lengthy] service;<br />じょれつ【序列】 rank; ranking;<br />雇用慣行 an employment practice; <br />かんこう9【慣行】 (a) ┌customary practice; a custom;
"多くの大学生は、締切日ぎりぎりまで、<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">宿題を[...</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">やる, not]</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">きらいがある</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>064 Advanced Topics - Tendencies - Describing a negative tendency using 「きらいがある」</div> Definitions:<br><br>ぎりぎり (adj-na,adv) (1) at the last moment, just barely
"コーディングが好きな開発者は、ちゃんとしたドキュメント作成と<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">十分なテストを怠[...]きらいがある</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>065 Advanced Topics - Tendencies - Describing a negative tendency using 「きらいがある」</div> Definitions:<br><br>開発者 a developer.<br />さく‐せい【作成】　書類などをつくりあげること<br />おこた･る【怠る･惰る】 _他五_すべきことをしないでおく
"相手は剣の達人だ。そう簡単には<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">勝[...]まい</span>。"	  <div class='notes'>066 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Negative Volitional</div> Definitions:<br><br>つるぎ【剣】 a sword<br />たつ‐じん【達人】 [左伝昭公七年] __学術または技芸に通達した人
"そんな無茶な手段は<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">認[...polite]まい</span>！"	  <div class='notes'>067 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Negative Volitional</div> Definitions:<br><br>むちゃ【無茶】 1 〔途方もないこと･でたらめなこと〕 ～な absurd; unreasonable.<br />しゅ‐だん【手段】 目的を達するための具体的なやり方
"その時までは決して<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">彼に会[...]まい</span>と心に決めていた。"	  <div class='notes'>068 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Negative Volitional</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"あの人は、<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">二度と嘘を</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">付</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">[...]まい</span>と誓ったのです。"	  <div class='notes'>069 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Negative Volitional</div> Definitions:<br><br>ちかう【誓う】 swear 《to do, that…》; vow 《to do, that…》;

"あいつが<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">大学に入[...volit]うが入[...]まいが</span>、俺とは関係ないよ。"	  <div class='notes'>072 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Using the volitional to express a lack of relation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">時間が[...</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ある volit]</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">うが[...</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">ある]</span><span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">まいが</span>、間に合わせるしかない。"	  <div class='notes'>073 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Using the volitional to express a lack of relation</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"最近のウィルスは強力で、<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">プログラムを実行[...する volit]が[...する]まいが</span>、ページを見るだけで感染するらしい。"	  <div class='notes'>074 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Using the volitional to express a lack of relation</div> Definitions:<br><br>きょう‐りょく【強力】キヤウ‥　力や作用が強いこと｡また､強い力<br />じっ‐こう【実行】‥カウ　__実際に行うこと｡｢公約を―する｣<br />かん‐せん【感染】　(infection) 　__病原体が体中に侵入すること｡また､病気がうつること
今後50年、人間が直面するであろう問題に正面から向き合って、自ら解決をはかりつつ、そのノウハウが次の産業となるシナリオを考えたい。	  <div class='notes'>075 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Using 「であろう」 to express likelihood</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
もちろん、生徒数減少の現在、学科の新設は困難であろうが、職業科の統廃合や科内コースの改編などで時代に合わせた変革が求められているはずである。	  <div class='notes'>076 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Using 「であろう」 to express likelihood</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
どんな商品でもネットで販売するだけで売上が伸びるというものではなかろう。	  <div class='notes'>077 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Using 「かろう」 as volitional for 「い」 endings</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
運動を始めるのが早かろうが遅かろうが、健康にいいというのは変わりません。	  <div class='notes'>078 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Using 「かろう」 as volitional for 「い」 endings</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
休日であろうが、なかろうが、この仕事では関係ないみたい。	  <div class='notes'>079 Advanced Topics - Advanced Volitional - Using 「かろう」 as volitional for 「い」 endings</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"この<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">ドキュメントは間違え[...]だらけ</span>で、全然役に立たない。"	  <div class='notes'>080 Advanced Topics - Covered by something - Using 「だらけ」 when an object is riddled everywhere with something</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">散歩[...]がてら</span>、タバコを買いに行きました。"	  <div class='notes'>096 Advanced Topics - Others - Using 「～がてら」 to do two things at one time</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"事情を2時間かけて<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">説明を[...する]あげく</span>、納得してもらえなかった"	  <div class='notes'>098 Advanced Topics - Others - Using 「～あげく（挙句）」 to describe a bad result</div> Definitions:<br><br>なっ‐とく【納得】　承知すること｡なるほどと認めること｡了解｡
"先生と<span style=""font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">相談[...]あげく</span>、退学することにした。"	  <div class='notes'>099 Advanced Topics - Others - Using 「～あげく（挙句）」 to describe a bad result</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">毎日</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; color:#0000ff;"">同じ物を食</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">べるの</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">は、面白くない。</span>"	<div class='notes'>126 Basic Grammar - Noun-related Particles: The 「の」 particle</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">電気</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; color:#0000ff;"">が</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; color:#0000ff;"">点</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">いた</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">。</span>"	<div class='notes'>096 Basic Grammar - Transative and Intransitive Verbs: Pay attention to particles!</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">ボブは、魚が好きなんだ</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">よね</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">。／そうだね。</span>"	<div class='notes'>149 Basic Grammar - Using Adverbs and Gobi: Combining both to get 「よね」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">魚</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">だ</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">。</span>"	<div class='notes'>002 Basic Grammar - Expressing State-of-Being: Declaring something is so and so using 「だ」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">猫は</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">いない</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">。</span>"	<div class='notes'>051 Basic Grammar - Negative Verbs: Conjugating verbs into the negative</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"<span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">日本語は、たくさん勉強したけど</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">な</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">。まだ全然分からない。／大丈夫よ。きっと分かるようになるから</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">さ</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">。／ならいいけど</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">な</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">。</span>"	<div class='notes'>401 Essential Grammar - Wrapping up section 4 and more gobi - The next most often used gobi: 「な」 and 「さ」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"<span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">おい、行く</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">ぞ</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">！</span>"	<div class='notes'>405 Essential Grammar - Wrapping up section 4 and more gobi - Gender-specific emphasis gobi: 「わ」、<b>「ぞ」</b>、「ぜ」、「かしら」</div> Definitions:<br><br>None
"<span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">先生が学生に宿題をたくさん</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">さ</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; color:#0000ff;"">せた</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">。</span>"	<div class='notes'>003 Special Expressions - Causative and Passive Verbs - Causative Verbs</div> Definitions:<br><br>None

"<span style=""font-family:'Mincho'"">早くきて。映画は、今ちょうど</span><span style=""color:#0000ff;"">良</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; font-weight:600; color:#0000ff;"">い</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho'; color:#0000ff;"">ところ</span><span style=""font-family:'Mincho';"">だよ。</span>"	<div class='notes'>074 Special Expressions - Special Expressionss with generic nouns. - Using 「ところ」 as an abstract place, time or characteristic</div> Definitions:<br><br>ちょうど - (adverb)&nbsp;exactly; precisely; just; right​

 <div class='expression'>笹を食べながらのんびりするのは最高だなぁ</div>         	<div class='reading'></div> <div class='meaning'>Being carefree while eating bamboo grass is the best.</div> <div class='notes'>のんびり - (adverb; suru-verb) carefree; at leisure</div>

 <div class='expression'>朝起きて一番に中庭に集まって 家族みんなで太極拳をします</div>         	<div class='reading'><ruby><rb>朝</rb><rt>あさ</rt></ruby><ruby><rb>起</rb><rt>お</rt></ruby>きて<ruby><rb>一</rb><rt>いち</rt></ruby><ruby><rb>番</rb><rt>ばん</rt></ruby>に<ruby><rb>中</rb><rt>なか</rt></ruby><ruby><rb>庭</rb><rt>にわ</rt></ruby> に<ruby><rb>集</rb><rt>あつ</rt></ruby>まって<ruby><rb>家</rb><rt>か</rt></ruby><ruby><rb>族</rb><rt>ぞく</rt></ruby> みんなで<ruby><rb>太</rb><rt>たい</rt></ruby><ruby><rb>極</rb><rt>きょく</rt></ruby><ruby><rb>拳</rb><rt>けん</rt></ruby>をします</div> <div class='meaning'>We wake up in the morning, &nbsp;gather in the courtyard first, and do Tai Chi with everyone in the family.</div> <div class='notes'>一番 - (noun) number one; first; first place<div>集まる - (u-verb) to gather; to collect; to assemble​</div><div>庭 - (noun) garden; yard; courtyard</div><div>家族 - (noun) family; members of a family​</div><div>太極拳 - (noun) grand ultimate fist; Tai Chi Chuan</div></div>
